Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Aberrant Ground.name: Aberrant Ground
Aberrant Ground.description: The ground in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=zVznqPXgYjETqpQz]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name]] is &Reference[Difficult Terrain].

Gibbering.name: Gibbering
Gibbering.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] babbles incoherently while it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]], any [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]] that starts its turn within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while it is babbling.

Failure: The target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does during the current turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition. The target dies if it is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack. Its body is then absorbed into the [[lookup @name]], leaving only equipment behind.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone] condition.

Blinding Spittle.name: Blinding Spittle
Blinding Spittle.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within [[lookup @range.value activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the user’s next turn.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: [[lookup @name]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when they is on the Material Plane.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: [[lookup @name]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. They take [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes two [[/item Withering Touch]] attacks.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: [[lookup @name]] casts the [[/item .qlCYQCwd31yLrsEn]]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. [[lookup @name]] is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

qlCYQCwd31yLrsEn.name: Etherealness
qlCYQCwd31yLrsEn.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Horrific Visage.name: Horrific Visage
Horrific Visage.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]]-foot Cone that can see [[lookup @name]] and isn't an Undead.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of [[lookup @name]]'s next turn.

Success: The target is immune to [[lookup @name]]'s Horrifying Visage for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Possession.name: Possession
Possession.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] [[lookup @name]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] feet.

Failure: The target is possessed by [[lookup @name]]; [[lookup @name]] disappears, and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body. [[lookup @name]] now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. [[lookup @name]] can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. [[lookup @name]]'s game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or [[lookup @name]] leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, [[lookup @name]] appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

Success: The target is immune to [[lookup @name]]'s Possession for 24 hours.

Incapacitated.name: Incapacitated
Incapacitated.description: The target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body.

Arsenic Breath.name: Arsenic Breath
Arsenic Breath.description:
Jarelle exhales a cloud of poisonous mist.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=6GlrFj94wnQ9RRWM]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=6GlrFj94wnQ9RRWM]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=6GlrFj94wnQ9RRWM]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until it finishes a Long Rest.

Success: Half damage only.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until it finishes a Long Rest.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Beard]] attack and one [[/item Infernal Glaive]] attack.

Beard.name: Beard
Beard.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can't regain Hit Points.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the user's next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Infernal Glaive.name: Infernal Glaive
Infernal Glaive.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature and doesn't already have an infernal wound, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=4qy3fKL086OAE1xR]].

Failure: The target receives an infernal wound. While wounded, the target loses [[/damage average activity=IS4utGV80LpDrjvt]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a [[/check format=long activity=KNWa0TFhANjmQCds]].

Nhakazarin.name: Nhakazarin
Nhakazarin.description: The leader of the Cult of the Canker keeps the ghouls focused on their unholy mission—and must also keep the other ghouls well-fed or fall prey to a usurper.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or an elf, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=fAF8MUfpRjKQw6ym]].

Failure: The target contracts a magical contagion called Ghoul Fever. This contagion functions as @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.PsUeY10v8e07V3g2#magical-contagions]{Sewer Plague}, except that the target develops a growing craving for rotting flesh and disgust at all other food, and upon death the victim rises at the next midnight as a Ghoul.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or elf, it subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=cWuWjTtfx98Ex6It]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .gq7zOuUvubtN1ry4]]{Chill Touch} (2d10 Necrotic damage), [[/item .rqwnTjElqH40wneX]]{Eldritch Blast} (two beams), [[/item .cYLk5V8OZEoZCg2Q]]{Mage Hand}

2/Day Each: [[/item .QDVJ5KCgaW33kQ0W]]{Bane} (level 2 version), [[/item .S0CBlUnMnFO0n1HC]]{Darkness}, [[/item .nBPgK1CNOIwP9O7Y]]{Inflict Wounds} (level 2 version), [[/item .iFjaWnifTwzJ0yXU]]{Mage Armor} (included in AC)

1/Day Each: [[/item .cMK4z83SHSp3Eyom]]{Dispel Magic}, [[/item .2h0F10C0gVkbRykQ]]{Ray of Enfeeblement}, [[/item .ZP0d2UbRYp43L31P]]{Vampiric Touch}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

[[(floor((@details.level+1)/6)+1)]]{Total Beams}

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must each make a Charisma saving throw. Whenever a target that fails this save makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must subtract 1d4 from the attack roll or save.

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description:
Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

Blocked Healing.name: Blocked Healing
Blocked Healing.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Inflict Wounds.name: Inflict Wounds
Inflict Wounds.description:
A creature you touch makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Vampiric Touch.name: Vampiric Touch
Vampiric Touch.description:
The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 Necrotic damage, and you regain Hit Points equal to half the amount of Necrotic damage dealt.

Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as a Magic action, targeting the same creature or a different one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
[[lookup @name]] devours a chunk of flesh from the corpse of a non-Construct creature that died within the past hour.

[[lookup @name]] regains [[/heal activity=eWjH9iJfZNIshmrR]] if the creature was Undead, or [[/heal activity=u9WKRpRoQwk1Ngpi]] Hit Points if it was any other creature. [[lookup @name]] can’t regain Hit Points from that corpse again.

Alternatively, [[lookup @name]] can consume a chunk of flesh from their masterpiece (in area C34). If they do, instead of regaining Hit Points, their Speed increases to 60 feet and they can use a Bonus Action to make a [[/item Claw]] attack. These benefits last until the end of the [[lookup @name]]'s next turn. [[lookup @name]] typically carries one scrap of tattooed skin.

Staff of Withering.name: Staff of Withering
Staff of Withering.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff}, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This staff has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

The staff can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff. On a hit, it deals damage as a normal Quarterstaff, and you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d10 Necrotic damage to the target and force it to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage for 1 hour on any ability check or saving throw that uses Strength or Constitution.

Foundry Note

The Save activity includes an Active Effect for tracking the disadvantage.

Withered.name: Withered
Withered.description: The target has Disadvantage for 1 hour on any ability check or saving throw that uses Strength or Constitution.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRottingTouch00]] attacks.

Wight.name: Wight
Wight.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmStuddedLea]{Studded Leather Armor}

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .mmNecroticSword0]] or [[/item .mmNecroticBow000]] in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmLifeDrain00000]].

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description:
Life Drain.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]], one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]] within [[lookup @range.value activity=FA4Mt9cXsYfHDDcs]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmZombie00000000]{Zombie} under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at a time.

Undead Fortitude.name: Undead Fortitude
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces the hand to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the hand clings to its throat. While clinging to the target, the hand moves with the target, and the target can’t speak. The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can detach the hand as an action.

Mark Quarry.name: Mark Quarry
Mark Quarry.description:
The hand can choose a quarry by touching a creature’s blood. If the hand lacks a quarry, it can mark any creature it hits with a [[/item Claw]] attack as its quarry.

The creature remains the hand’s quarry until it dies or until the hand gains a new quarry.

The hand has Advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track its quarry, and it deals an extra [[/damage average]] damage when it hits its quarry with its [[/item Claw]] attack.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Onl.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Onl.description: In humanoid form, Jaul makes three [[/item Dagger]] attacks. In hybrid form, he can attack like a humanoid or make one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claw]] attack.

Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only).name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only).description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 11.

Failure: The target is cursed. If the cursed target drops to 0 Hit Points, it instead becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmWerewolf000000]{Werewolf} under the GM’s control and has 10 Hit Points.

Success: The target is immune to Jaul’s curse for 24 hours.

Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only).name: Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only)
Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only).description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no {type} components and using {ability} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPoisonSpra]{Poison Spray} (2d12 Poison damage), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplProduceFla]{Produce Flame} (2d8 Fire damage)

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCureWounds]{Cure Wounds}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFlamingSph]{Flaming Sphere}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSpikeGrowt]{Spike Growth}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplConjureAni]{Conjure Animals}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRevivify00]{Revivify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSleetStorm]{Sleet Storm}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWaterBreat]{Water Breathing}

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: [[lookup @name]] shape-shifts into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or a Medium wolf, or he returns to his true humanoid form. His game statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Keen Hearing and Smell.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Keen Hearing and Smell.description: [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Poison Spray.name: Poison Spray
Poison Spray.description:
You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 Poison damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d12 when you reach levels 5 (2d12), 11 (3d12), and 17 (4d12).

Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
Produce Flame.description:
A flickering flame appears in your hand and remains there for the duration. While there, the flame emits no heat and ignites nothing, and it sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to hurl fire at a creature or an object within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Fire damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Flaming Sphere.name: Flaming Sphere
Flaming Sphere.description:
You create a 5-foot-diameter sphere of fire in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere makes a [[/save ability=dex dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw, taking 2d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet, rolling it along the ground. If you move the sphere into a creature’s space, that creature makes the save against the sphere, and the sphere stops moving for the turn.

When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. Flammable objects that aren’t being worn or carried start burning if touched by the sphere, and it sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 2.

Spike Growth.name: Spike Growth
Spike Growth.description:
The ground in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes Difficult Terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes [[/damage 2d4 type=piercing]] damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can’t see the area when the spell is cast must take a Search action and succeed on a [[/check ability=wis skill=prc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] or [[/check ability=wis skill=sur dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

Conjure Animals.name: Conjure Animals
Conjure Animals.description:
You conjure nature spirits that appear as a Large pack of spectral, intangible animals in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The pack lasts for the duration, and you choose the spirits’ animal form, such as wolves, serpents, or birds.

You have Advantage on Strength saving throws while you’re within 5 feet of the pack, and when you move on your turn, you can also move the pack up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Whenever the pack moves within 10 feet of a creature you can see and whenever a creature you can see enters a space within 10 feet of the pack or ends its turn there, you can force that creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d10 Slashing damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 3.

Revivify.name: Revivify
Revivify.description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature revives with 1 Hit Point. This spell can’t revive a creature that has died of old age, nor does it restore any missing body parts.

materials.value: a diamond worth 300+ GP, which the spell consumes

Sleet Storm.name: Sleet Storm
Sleet Storm.description:
Until the spell ends, sleet falls in a 40-foot-tall, 20-foot-radius Cylinder centered on a point you choose within range. The area is &Reference[heavilyobscured], and exposed flames in the area are doused.

Ground in the Cylinder is &Reference[difficultterrain]. When a creature enters the Cylinder for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[prone] condition and lose &Reference[concentration].

Water Breathing.name: Water Breathing
Water Breathing.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

Bejeweled Necklace.name: Bejeweled Necklace
Bejeweled Necklace.description: A bejeweled necklace featuring a porpoise and an engraving which reads "Ayla, My Beloved".

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: Otari can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane while on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: Otari can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. He takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

Site-Bound.name: Site-Bound
Site-Bound.description: Otari can’t leave area D18. He can’t be destroyed permanently until the four icons are placed on the altar in area D13.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: Otari enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. He is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but he can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Otari deals an extra 17 (5d6) damage when he hits a target with an attack and has Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Otari that doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and Otari doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

damage.condition: Hits a target and has Advantage on the attack roll

Infest Shadow.name: Infest Shadow
Infest Shadow.description:
Otari teleports into the shadow of a creature he can see within 30 feet of him and makes a [[/item Withering Touch]] attack against a creature within 5 feet of that creature (but not the creature whose shadow he infests). On a hit, attacks against the target have Disadvantage until the start of Otari’s next turn. Otari then teleports back to his starting point.

The creature whose shadow Otari infests contracts Filth Fever, the disease that killed Otari. The creature has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Whenever the Poisoned creature finishes a Long Rest, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15.

Failure: The creature’s Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) and doesn’t return to normal until the Poisoned condition ends.

Success: The Poisoned condition ends.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane while on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Frightening Appearance.name: Frightening Appearance
Frightening Appearance.description:
When the poltergeist enters the Material Plane from the Ethereal Plane, each creature that can see them in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the poltergeist is subjected to the following effect. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition for 1 minute. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Frightened condition on itself on a success.

Success: The creature is immune to this poltergeist’s Frightening Appearance for the next 24 hours.

save.condition: Enters the Material Plane from the Ethereal Plane

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. They take [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if they end their turn inside an object.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Telekinetic Object]] attacks.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

Telekinetic Object.name: Telekinetic Object
Telekinetic Object.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]] (depending on the object). If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC 13.

Failure: The target is pushed up to 10 feet away from the poltergeist and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

save.condition: If the target of the attack was a creature

Telekinetic Storm.name: Telekinetic Storm
Telekinetic Storm.description:
Dozens of objects whirl around the poltergeist in a storm of rage.

Strength Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the poltergeist.

Failure: 7 (2d6) Bludgeoning damage, 7 (2d6) Piercing damage, and 7 (2d6) Slashing damage and the target has the Prone condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Telekinetic Defense.name: Telekinetic Defense
Telekinetic Defense.description: Trigger: A creature the poltergeist can see enters a space within 10 feet of it. Response: The poltergeist makes a [[/item Telekinetic Object]] attack against the creature.

Vaulgrist.name: Vaulgrist
Vaulgrist.description:
Chain Devil

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmAppendixMonste.JournalEntryPage.ZshK0GnbqU7TpaWe caption=false cite=false classes="no-embed mm free-rules-embed"]

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Diabolical Restoration.name: Diabolical Restoration
Diabolical Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmChain000000000]] attacks and uses [[/item .mmConjureInferna]].

Conjure Infernal Chain.name: Conjure Infernal Chain
Conjure Infernal Chain.description:
The devil conjures a fiery chain to bind a creature.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=9vCVJrzUZL0ra4w2]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=9vCVJrzUZL0ra4w2]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=9vCVJrzUZL0ra4w2]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn, at which point the chain disappears. If the target is Large or smaller, the devil moves the target up to 30 feet straight toward itself.

Success: The chain disappears.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Unnerving Gaze.name: Unnerving Gaze
Unnerving Gaze.description:
Trigger: A [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see starts its turn within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Response—Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]], the triggering [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=btp6NZvx465nxWTF]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Unnerving Gaze for 24 hours.

Save.name: Save
Save.condition: A creature the devil can see

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its turn.

Chain.name: Chain
Chain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two chains, and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) from one of two chains, and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Weakened.name: Weakened
Weakened.description:
Vaulgrist has Disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, reducing her Challenge Rating to 6 (2,300 XP).

Note: Disadvantage on attack rolls is not automatic.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The voidglutton’s eyes and the tips of their fingers glow with colored light, casting Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The voidglutton can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. The voidglutton takes [[/damage 1d10 force average]] damage if they end their turn inside an object.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The voidglutton has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The voidglutton makes two [[/item Ectoplasmic Claw]] attacks. In place of one attack, it can use [[/item Ectoplasmic Web]].

Ectoplasmic Claw.name: Ectoplasmic Claw
Ectoplasmic Claw.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the voidglutton scores a Critical Hit, the target has the &Reference[Frightened] condition until the end of the voidglutton’s next turn.

Ectoplasmic Web.name: Ectoplasmic Web
Ectoplasmic Web.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature the voidglutton can see within 60 feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition, even if it has the Incorporeal Movement trait, until the web is destroyed (AC 15; HP 15; Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage).

Feed on Light.name: Feed on Light
Feed on Light.description: The voidglutton casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15). While the voidglutton is in the area, their Illumination trait is suppressed and they have the &Reference[Blinded] condition, except that they can see creatures that are dying and those with the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition in the area. The darkness lasts until the voidglutton’s &Reference[Concentration] ends on this effect. The voidglutton’s Concentration ends early immediately after the voidglutton makes an attack roll, uses [[/item Feed on Fear,]] or uses Feed on Light again.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can’t see through it, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn’t being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description: The voidglutton makes an [[/item Ectoplasmic Claw]] attack.

Feed on Fear.name: Feed on Fear
Feed on Fear.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature that is dying or has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition that the voidglutton can see within 30 feet of them.

Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage.

Success: Half damage.

Success or Failure: The voidglutton regains Hit Points equal to the Psychic damage dealt.

affects.special: creature that is dying or has the Frightened condition

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
On Initiative count 20 (losing all Initiative ties), the voidglutton can harness the ambient magic in area D12, D13, D19, or D20 to cause one of the following effects. It can’t do so while it has the Incapacitated condition or if it is otherwise unable to take actions. If surprised, it can’t create any effect until after its first turn in combat. It can’t create the same effect two rounds in a row.

An illusory memory of Belcorra’s victory over adventurers in the past plays out in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the voidglutton can see within 60 feet of it. A creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until it leaves the area. The illusion is short, but it repeats over and over. The illusion vanishes if the voidglutton dies or if it creates a different effect.

Ectoplasmic webbing fills a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the voidglutton can see within 60 feet of it. The webs are &Reference[Difficult Terrain] and make the area &Reference[Lightly Obscured]. The webs disappear if the voidglutton dies or if it creates a different effect.

Coalesced Swarm.name: Coalesced Swarm
Coalesced Swarm.description: Volluk can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and he can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny leech. When a creature starts its turn in Volluk’s space, that creature takes [[/damage 2d6 piercing average]] damage, or [[/damage 1d6 piercing average]] damage if Volluk is &Reference[Bloodied]. Volluk then regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Volluk makes two [[/item Tendril of Leeches]] attacks.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Volluk casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplChillTouch]{Chill Touch} (2d10 Necrotic damage), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Actor.EN3mp0sVObP8ou3p.Item.QGteYDcLHSeCHWsH]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplUnseenServ]{Unseen Servant}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.jsGETf81F0K069wO]{Worm’s Repast} (page 221)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplStinkingCl]{Stinking Cloud}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Discorporate.name: Discorporate
Discorporate.description: When Volluk is reduced to 0 Hit Points, his body scatters into [[/r 1d12 + 12]] squirming leeches that attempt to flee. If even one leech escapes, Volluk can build a new body within [[/r 1d10]] days. Typically, at least one leech escapes 1 minute after Volluk dies, although circumstances might prolong this time, at the GM’s discretion. The most reliable way to kill the remaining leeches is to deal damage to an area that includes Volluk’s space, with each point of damage dealt killing one leech. A creature within 5 feet of Volluk’s space can use an action to kill one leech automatically.

Hated Memories.name: Hated Memories
Hated Memories.description: If Volluk starts his turn and can see an accurate representation of his appearance as a living drow, he must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, Volluk can’t use Reactions or Legendary Actions until the start of his next turn.

save.condition: Starts turn and sees an accurate representation of his appearance

Tendril of Leeches.name: Tendril of Leeches
Tendril of Leeches.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, leeches cling to it. The target loses [[/damage 1d6 average]] Hit Points from blood loss at the start of each of its turns until the target or a creature within 5 feet of it removes and kills the leeches as an action.

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description:
Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Necrotic damage, and it can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

Blocked Healing.name: Blocked Healing
Blocked Healing.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell’s range.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn’t being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Study.name: Study
Study.condition: Study Action taken by other creature

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Disguise Self.name: Disguise Self
Disguise Self.description:
You make yourself—including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person—look different until the spell ends. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear heavier or lighter. You must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs as you have. Otherwise, the extent of the illusion is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC.

Disguised.name: Disguised
Disguised.description: To discern that you are disguised, a creature must take the Study action to inspect your appearance and succeed on an [[/check ability=int skill=inv]] check against your spell save DC.

Scorching Ray.name: Scorching Ray
Scorching Ray.description:
You hurl three fiery rays. You can hurl them at one target within range or at several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 Fire damage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create one additional ray for each spell slot level above 2.

[[@item.level + 1]]{Total Rays}

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Unseen Servant.name: Unseen Servant
Unseen Servant.description:
This spell creates an Invisible, mindless, shapeless, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 Hit Point, and a Strength of 2, and it can’t attack. If it drops to 0 Hit Points, the spell ends.

Once on each of your turns as a Bonus Action, you can mentally command the servant to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The servant can perform simple tasks that a human could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring drinks. Once you give the command, the servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.

If you command the servant to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.

materials.value: a bit of string and of wood

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can’t see through it, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn’t being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration or until a strong wind (such as the one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Each creature that starts its turn in the Sphere must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the &Reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the current turn. While Poisoned in this way, the creature can’t take an action or a Bonus Action.

Staff of Swarming Insects.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff}, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard)

This staff has 10 charges.

Insect Cloud. While holding the staff, you can take a Magic action and expend 1 charge to cause a swarm of harmless flying insects to fill a 30-foot Emanation originating from you. The insects remain for 10 minutes, making the area &Reference[Heavily Obscured] for creatures other than you. A strong wind (like that created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses the swarm and ends the effect.

Spells. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack modifier. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell.

Spell

Charge Cost

Regaining Charges. The staff regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, a swarm of insects consumes and destroys the staff, then disperses.

FVTT Note: In accordance with Chafkhem's stat block, this weapon has been modified to deal 1d8 bludgeoning, and 3d6 additional necrotic damage. However, this is not an inherent property of this weapon, and only reflects its damage when wielded by Chafkhem himself. If a PC takes and wields this item, ensure that you remove the additional damage accordingly.

Giant Insect.name: Giant Insect
Giant Insect.description:
You summon a giant centipede, spider, or wasp (chosen when you cast the spell). It manifests in an unoccupied space you can see within range and uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbmobGiantInsec]{Giant Insect} stat block. The form you choose determines certain details in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 Hit Points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the creature shares your Initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the &Reference[Dodge] action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Use the spell slot's level for the spell's level in the stat block.

In addition to the noted usage of the spell's level in the insect's Traits and Actions, the following attributes are also affected.

Giant Insect
AC11 + the spell's level
HP30 + 10 for each spell level above 4
Speed40 ft., Climb 40 ft., Fly 40 ft. (Wasp only)
PBequals your Proficiency Bonus

When the swarm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Cratonys.name: Cratonys
Cratonys.description:
Belcorra’s magic binds Cratonys to this level, preventing the chain devil from leaving. After centuries surrounded by mindless aberrations and the twisted logic of the seugathis, she has gone feral and lost all sense of purpose. She doesn’t speak or respond to any who speak to her, but she lashes out in a desire to inflict pain. She fights from the room’s west end, using the rusty chains to strike her foes.

Infernal Tetanus.name: Infernal Tetanus
Infernal Tetanus.description:
The creature feels stiff and gains 1 level of Exhaustion. The creature’s Exhaustion can’t decrease normally while the contagion persists. Every week, the creature repeats the saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains another level of Exhaustion. On a success, the creature’s level of Exhaustion decreases by 1. The contagion ends if the creature’s level of Exhaustion drops below 1.

While a creature’s level of Exhaustion is at least 3, it can’t speak. Each time a creature’s level of Exhaustion worsens to 4 or more, the creature suffers spasms strong enough to break bones, and it must make a successful [[/save 15 con]] saving throw or its Strength score is reduced by [[/r 1d4]] (to a minimum of 1) until the contagion ends. While the creature’s level of Exhaustion is 5, the creature has the Paralyzed condition.

Sneak Attack.description: The assassin deals an extra [[/damage 4d6 average]] damage when they hit a target with an attack and has Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and the assassin doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Sunlight Weakness.name: Sunlight Weakness
Sunlight Weakness.description: While in sunlight, the assassin has Disadvantage on D20 tests.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane while on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Frightening Appearance.name: Frightening Appearance
Frightening Appearance.description:
When the poltergeist enters the Material Plane from the Ethereal Plane, each creature that can see them in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the poltergeist is subjected to the following effect. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition for 1 minute. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Frightened condition on itself on a success.

Success: The creature is immune to this poltergeist’s Frightening Appearance for the next 24 hours.

save.condition: Enters the Material Plane from the Ethereal Plane

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. They take [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if they end their turn inside an object.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Telekinetic Object]] attacks.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

Telekinetic Object.name: Telekinetic Object
Telekinetic Object.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]] (depending on the object). If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC 13.

Failure: The target is pushed up to 10 feet away from the poltergeist and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

save.condition: If the target of the attack was a creature

Telekinetic Storm.name: Telekinetic Storm
Telekinetic Storm.description:
Dozens of objects whirl around the poltergeist in a storm of rage.

Strength Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Emanation originating from the poltergeist.

Failure: 7 (2d6) Bludgeoning damage, 7 (2d6) Piercing damage, and 7 (2d6) Slashing damage and the target has the Prone condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Telekinetic Defense.name: Telekinetic Defense
Telekinetic Defense.description: Trigger: A creature the poltergeist can see enters a space within 10 feet of it. Response: The poltergeist makes a [[/item Telekinetic Object]] attack against the creature.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Corrosive Form.name: Corrosive Form
Corrosive Form.description:
A creature that hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] with a melee attack roll takes [[/damage average]] damage. Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed immediately after hitting the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and dealing any damage. Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative −1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and coming into contact with it. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches −5. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} spell on the weapon.

In 1 minute, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can eat through 2 feet of nonmagical wood or metal.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Attack Penalty active effect that will modify a targeted weapon. Since this penalty can be applied multiple times to multiple nonmagical weapons, this active effect needs to be dragged from this item's Effect tab onto the target Item's weapons.

Damaged: -1 Attack.name: Damaged: -1 Attack
Damaged: -1 Attack.description: Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative −1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the attacking creature and coming into contact with it.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Split.name: Split
Split.description: Trigger: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=zoXFSgzmWq8frUjI]] Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] splits into two new [[lookup @name capitalize]]. Each new [[lookup @name lowercase]] is one size smaller than the original [[lookup @name lowercase]] and acts on its Initiative. The original [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Hit Points are divided evenly between the new [[lookup @name lowercase]]s (round down).

Split.name: Split
Split.condition: is Large or Medium and has 10+ Hit Points, it becomes Bloodied or is subjected to Lightning or Slashing damage.

Dissolving Pseudopod.name: Dissolving Pseudopod
Dissolving Pseudopod.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000]{Mending} spell on the armor.

Damaged: -1 AC.name: Damaged: -1 AC
Damaged: -1 AC.description: Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

Needle Spray.name: Needle Spray
Needle Spray.description:
The dreshkan fires a spray of electrified needles.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Awaiting Needle.name: Awaiting Needle
Awaiting Needle.description:
Trigger: A creature the dreshkan can see attacks the dreshkan and the attack roll misses by 5 or more.

Response: The dreshkan makes a melee or ranged [[/item Needle]] attack against that creature.

Alchemical Implants.name: Alchemical Implants
Alchemical Implants.description: The dreshkan has Advantage on saving throws against &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] and the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] and &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] conditions. Magic that restores a creature’s Hit Points restores only half as many Hit Points to the dreshkan.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the dreshkan has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
Swarming Stance.description: The dreshkan can occupy the same space as another willing creature with this trait. While they share a creature’s space in this way, the dreshkan makes melee attack rolls with Advantage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dreshkan makes two melee attacks.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmForeleg0000000]] or [[/item .mmPoisonBurst000]] in any combination.

Magic of the Spider Queen.name: Magic of the Spider Queen
Magic of the Spider Queen.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFaerieFire]{Faerie Fire}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWeb0000000]{Web}, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]).

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are &Reference[difficultterrain], and the area within them is &Reference[lightlyobscured].

If the webs aren't anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

The first time a creature enters the webs on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained] condition while in the webs or until it breaks free.

A creature Restrained by the webs can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer Restrained.

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot Cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing [[/damage 2d4 type=fire]] damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

Falxi Orshendiel.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongbow000]{Longbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepShortsword]{Shortsword}

Aversion to Fire.name: Aversion to Fire
Aversion to Fire.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Averse.name: Averse
Averse.description: It has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] starts its turn &Reference[Bloodied], roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a 6, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] attacks an object. Once the [[lookup @name lowercase]] goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s creator, if within [[lookup @range.value activity=tnkOsrSwEElO2kZM]] feet of the berserk [[lookup @name lowercase]], can try to calm it by taking an action to make a [[/check ability=cha skill=per dc=@abilities.str.dc]] DC 15 Charisma (Persuasion) check; the golem must be able to hear its creator. If this check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk until the start of its next turn, at which point it resumes rolling for the Berserk trait again if it is still Bloodied.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description: On each of its turns while berserk, the creature attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the creature attacks an object. Once the creature goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer &Reference[Bloodied apply=false].

Lightning Absorption.name: Lightning Absorption
Lightning Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]], any creature (other than a [[lookup @name lowercase]]) that starts its turn in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mJbwhj3beOIB3Jgj]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Success: The target is immune to the Stench of all [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 hour.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of its next turn.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Claw.name: Claw
Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a non-Undead creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=nDM4WpckiZjvBzfg]].

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: The target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.
