Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is [[lookup @activation.condition activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]]. Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds [[lookup @roll.formula activity=aLG3BRZL7P6OEjwd]] to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon

Gulzash.name: Gulzash
Gulzash.description: A lizardfolk born and raised in the Darklands, Gulzash found a taste for music early in life. He created his own battle lute and traveled until he met and joined Shadow Malice. The others enjoy his eager violence, but dislike his strong personal odor. He swings his battle lute in combat with reckless glee.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Mosh.name: Mosh
Mosh.description: Gulzash moves up to half his Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and pushes a creature he can see within 5 feet of him. That creature must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or it has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: Gulzash can hold his breath for 15 minutes.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Gulzash makes two melee attacks, each with a different weapon.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hold its breath for 1 hour.

Multiple Heads.name: Multiple Heads
Multiple Heads.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has five heads. Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 25 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns when it has at least one living head, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken Fire damage since its last turn. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains 20 Hit Points when it grows new heads.

Reactive Heads.name: Reactive Heads
Reactive Heads.description: For each head the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has beyond one, it gets an extra &Reference[Reaction] that can be used only for &Reference[OpportunityAttacks].

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes as many [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks as it has heads.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Jafaki casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEldritchBl], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]

3/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPhantasmal] (level 5 version)

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: [[/damage average activity=JVyYhU5Mh8db0hJw]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target makes Wisdom saving throws with Disadvantage.

Success: Half damage only.

Mind Fog.name: Mind Fog
Mind Fog.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from Jafaki. Creatures immune to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions until the end of their next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. Jafaki commands the target to use its action to move up to its Speed and make a melee attack against a creature of Jafaki’s choice.

Success: The target is immune to Mind Fog for 1 minute.

Foggy.name: Foggy
Foggy.description: The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions until the end of their next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn.

Wand of Lightning Bolts.name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
Wand of Lightning Bolts.description:
Wand (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IyikgTEOTv701jgQ]{Lightning Bolt} spell (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend.

The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Use Magic Device.name: Use Magic Device
Use Magic Device.description: Jafaki ignores all class, species, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

[[(floor((@details.level+1)/6)+1)]]{Total Beams}

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
Phantasmal Killer.description:
You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see within range and create an illusion of its deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 4d10 Psychic damage and has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the spell ends.

For the duration, the target makes a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes the Psychic damage again. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 4.

Fears Manifested.name: Fears Manifested
Fears Manifested.description:
The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for the duration.

For the duration, the target makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes the Psychic damage again. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Jafaki uses Mind Fog, then makes two attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and one with their [[/item Rapier]]. In place of their Rapier attack, Jafaki can use Spellcasting to cast [[/item Eldritch Blast]].

Necrotic Bomb (Moderate).name: Necrotic Bomb (Moderate)
Necrotic Bomb (Moderate).description:
Combining the worst parts of a rotting corpse with reagents most people consider unholy, Necrotic Bombs create a miasma of life-sucking substance when exposed to the air.

When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a Necrotic Bomb. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus).

On a failure, the target takes [[/damage activity=7iRwP152I2knBax2]] damage. Even on a successful save, the target takes [[/damage activity=Ty3NjHCoOamzoNkl]] damage. In addition, each creature within 5 feet of the target takes damage as if it had successfully saved against the bomb. Constructs take no damage from a Necrotic Bomb.

Sloughing Toxin.name: Sloughing Toxin
Sloughing Toxin.description: This complex toxin makes the muscles beneath a fleshwarpers find useful in their gruesome work. The victim’s rough or jerky movements concentrate the toxin in subdermal muscles and eventually cause skin and muscle to slough away. A creature subjected to this poison feels no effect until the end of its next turn. If the poison isn’t neutralized before that time, the creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] in this way, the creature’s skin becomes dry and its muscles burn painfully whenever it moves. The first time each turn the creature moves at least 5 feet or makes an attack roll, it takes [[/damage 1d4 Poison]] damage. At the end of each of its turns, the Poisoned creature must repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on success. If any subsequent saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature can’t attempt the save again until the poison runs its course.

Ichthyosis Mutagen.name: Ichthyosis Mutagen
Ichthyosis Mutagen.description: After drinking this stinking potion, your skin continually renews itself, thickening into large, scaly patches. For the next minute, your AC can’t be less than 11 + your Dexterity modifier, regardless of what kind of armor you are wearing. In addition, you regain 2 Hit Points at the start of each of your turns (or 20 Hit Points over the course of a minute). However, your thickened skin makes quick movement difficult, and your excess skin flakes off with the slightest movement. Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity

Enlarge/Reduce.name: Enlarge/Reduce
Enlarge/Reduce.description:
For the duration, the spell enlarges or reduces a creature or an object you can see within range (see the chosen effect below). A targeted object must be neither worn nor carried. If the target is an unwilling creature, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the spell has no effect.

Everything that a targeted creature is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item it drops returns to normal size at once. A thrown weapon or piece of ammunition returns to normal size immediately after it hits or misses a target.

Enlarge. The target's size increases by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. The target also has Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's attacks with its enlarged weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal an extra 1d4 damage on a hit.

Reduce. The target's size decreases by one category—from Medium to Small, for example. The target also has Disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's attacks with its reduced weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal 1d4 less damage on a hit (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

Enlarged.name: Enlarged
Enlarged.description: The target’s size increases by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. The target also has Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target’s attacks with its enlarged weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal an extra 1d4 damage on a hit.

Reduced.name: Reduced
Reduced.description: The target’s size decreases by one category—from Medium to Small, for example. The target also has Disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target’s attacks with its reduced weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal 1d4 less damage on a hit (this can’t reduce the damage below 1).

Invisibility.description: Kragala casts Invisibility on herself, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12).

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can’t restore magic to such an object.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else’s voice, a lion’s roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can’t create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Study.name: Study
Study.condition: Study Action taken by other creature

True Strike.name: True Strike
True Strike.description:
Guided by a flash of magical insight, you make one attack with the weapon used in the spell’s casting. The attack uses your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If the attack deals damage, it can be Radiant damage or the weapon’s normal damage type (your choice).

Cantrip Upgrade. Whether you deal Radiant damage or the weapon’s normal damage type, the attack deals extra Radiant damage when you reach levels 5 (1d6), 11 (2d6), and 17 (3d6).

materials.value: a weapon with which you have proficiency and that is worth 1+ CP

Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Heroism.name: Heroism
Heroism.description:
A willing creature you touch is imbued with bravery. Until the spell ends, the creature is immune to the Frightened condition and gains Temporary Hit Points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of its turns.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Bravery.name: Bravery

Thunderwave.description:
You unleash a wave of thunderous energy. Each creature in a 15-foot Cube originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 Thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

In addition, unsecured objects that are entirely within the Cube are pushed 10 feet away from you, and a thunderous boom is audible within 300 feet.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

You touch a creature and choose Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. For the duration, the target has Advantage on ability checks using the chosen ability.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2. You can choose a different ability for each target.

Enhanced Strength.name: Enhanced Strength

Enhanced Dexterity.name: Enhanced Dexterity

Enhanced Intelligence.name: Enhanced Intelligence

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

A nonmagical object that isn’t being worn or carried also takes the damage if it’s in the spell’s area.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

A creature Restrained by the webs can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer Restrained.

Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Vicious Mockery.name: Vicious Mockery
Vicious Mockery.description:
You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature you can see or hear within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d6 Psychic damage and have Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach levels 5 (2d6), 11 (3d6), and 17 (4d6).

Mocked.name: Mocked
Mocked.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with Advantage if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Bardic Inspiration.name: Bardic Inspiration
Bardic Inspiration.description: Kragala chooses one other creature within 60 feet of her. If that creature can see or hear her, it gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a d6. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time. Once within the next hour when the creature fails a D20 Test, the creature can roll the Bardic Inspiration die and add the number rolled to the d20, potentially turning the failure into a success. A Bardic Inspiration die is expended when it’s rolled.

Bardic Inspiration.name: Bardic Inspiration
Bardic Inspiration.description: The target gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a [[/r d6]]. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time. Once within the next hour when the creature fails a D20 Test, the creature can roll the Bardic Inspiration die and add the number rolled to the d20, potentially turning the failure into a success. A Bardic Inspiration die is expended when it’s rolled.

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Enthrall.name: Enthrall
Enthrall.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, a target has a −10 penalty to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Distracted.name: Distracted
Distracted.description: The target has a −10 penalty to [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description:
A loud noise erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered there makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 Thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has Disadvantage on the save.

A nonmagical object that isn’t being worn or carried also takes the damage if it’s in the spell’s area.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

Seugathi Servant.name: Seugathi Servant
Seugathi Servant.description: The most common seugathis spawned by neothelids are seugathi servants. Their masters equip them with tools useful in their tasks (often a wand and a weapon), and they rarely value other material things beyond their usefulness in their imprinted mission.

Bite.name: Bite

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] in this way, the target also makes Wisdom saving throws with Disadvantage.

Mind Fog.name: Mind Fog
Mind Fog.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot Emanation originating from the seugathi. Creatures immune to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions until the end of their next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The seugathi commands the target to move up to its Speed and make a melee attack against a creature of the seugathi’s choice.

Success: The target is immune to Mind Fog for 1 minute

Use Magic Device.name: Use Magic Device
Use Magic Device.description: The seugathi ignores all class, species, and level requirements on the use of magic items.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The seugathi uses [[/item Mind Fog]], then makes two attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and one with their [[/item Shortsword]].

Spellcasting.description:
The seugathi casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEldritchBl]{Eldritch Blast} (two beams), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl two beams of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can’t attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Shanrigol Behemoth.name: Shanrigol Behemoth
Shanrigol Behemoth.description:
Shanrigols that grow with the additions of many living victims can become truly enormous in size and pose a greater danger in their expanding hunting territory. Subterranean communities will collapse tunnels to stop a shanrigol behemoth from reaching their settlements.

Many shanrigol behemoths absorb enough brain matter to form crude intelligences and take a serpentine or humanoid shape. They’re more varied in their abilities than shanrigol heaps, as they often gain abilities from their constituent creatures. The shanrigol behemoth presented below contains flesh from driders and urdefhans, giving it a web attack and necrotic decay ability. Not all shanrigol behemoths have these two abilities, but should have other abilities to replace them.

Slam.name: Slam
Slam.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 18).

Web.name: Web
Web.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature the shanrigol can see within 60 feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10, HP 15; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage).

Hungry Slap.name: Hungry Slap
Hungry Slap.description:
Trigger: A creature within 10 feet of the shanrigol hits or misses it with an attack.

Response: The shanrigol makes a [[/item Slam]] attack against the creature.

Aberrant Unlife.name: Aberrant Unlife
Aberrant Unlife.description: The shanrigol is treated as both an Aberration and Undead creature for effects that rely on creature type.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the shanrigol dies, its flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the shanrigol.

Failure: 28 (8d6) Necrotic damage.

Success: Half damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The shanrigol makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks or two [[/item Bone Shard]] attacks. In place of one attack, it can use Sapping Squeeze or Web.

Sapping Squeeze.name: Sapping Squeeze
Sapping Squeeze.description:
One creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the shanrigol takes [[/damage average]] damage and is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 18.

Failure: The creature takes [[/damage average activity=RPJ34us9ytncodBv]] damage, and the shanrigol regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Undulating Step.name: Undulating Step
Undulating Step.description: The shanrigol moves up to its Speed. During this movement, the shanrigol &Reference[Difficult Terrain] doesn’t cost the shanrigol extra movement, and the shanrigol can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without expending extra movement to do so.

Vischari.name: Vischari
Vischari.description: All urdefhans are born to battle, but a rare few eschew manufactured weapons and fight only with their jaws and their fists. Those who survive become terrors of the battlefield and masters of unarmed combat.

At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition on a success.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

A Frightened creature takes the &Reference[dash] action and moves away from you by the safest route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a space where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends on that creature.

Aulr.name: Aulr
Aulr.description:
A gug’s most horrid feature is their barrel-shaped head, which splits vertically to reveal numerous rows of sharp, yellow teeth, and an open throat. The eyes on either side of their head-jaw are small but keen. Bony ridges protect their eyes from the frantic flailing of their prey, as they prefers meals of raw and writhing meat over fungi and molds. They grip said prey with powerful arms that split at the elbow into a pair of forearms, giving them four clawed paws. These monstrous brutes are covered with shaggy black fur, often crusted with gore.

Although gugs may seem bestial, they have keen and wicked intellects. Gugs lair far underground, but they sometimes come to the surface to hunt during dark nights, either alone or in small groups. As they possess voracious appetites, most gugs consume the creatures they catch, but some instead kidnap their victims and retreat below the surface, leaving only a lingering stench and odd, clawed paw prints. Victims are taken to rancid lairs marked with strange runes and sacrificed to the gugs’ wicked gods of blood, darkness, and nightmares. Dire rumors tell of lightless gug cities made of titanic blocks of stone far underground, where powerful gug leaders preach their vile doctrines to mobs of howling gugs.

Gugs have a strange relationship with ghouls, which seems to date from their shared origin in a distant subterranean world. Gugs live in fear of ghouls, despite towering over them; however, this strange fear doesn’t apply to ghasts, whom gugs consume as voraciously as they do other creatures.

Gugs stand 16 feet tall and weigh 2,000 pounds, although they have an eerie, graceful gait that belies their immense size. Their light step and ability to squeeze through very small crannies makes gugs common bogeymen in tales of strange disappearances or bloody massacres.

Azvalvigander.name: Azvalvigander
Azvalvigander.description:
Accuser devils, or zebubs, serve as Hell’s messengers and spies. Their ability to share what they’ve seen with other creatures makes them especially useful—not only to other devils, but also to mortal conjurers. Some infernal lords unleash them in enormous, horrid swarms upon unsuspecting lands to debase flesh and land alike while collecting secrets the infernal host might later put to use.

Zebubs use any opportunity to manipulate weak-willed or easily tempted mortals into serving the zebubs’ whims. While arrogant and deceitful, zebubs lack the cunning and confidence of most devils, and thus their schemes often focus on satisfying self-serving or self-destructive ambitions. Zebubs form from the souls of childish and craven mortals, reshaped by the archdevil Baalzebul in the frozen, filthy wastes of Hell’s seventh layer, Cocytus.

Gug.name: Gug
Gug.description:
A gug’s most horrid feature is their barrel-shaped head, which splits vertically to reveal numerous rows of sharp, yellow teeth, and an open throat. The eyes on either side of their head-jaw are small but keen. Bony ridges protect their eyes from the frantic flailing of their prey, as they prefers meals of raw and writhing meat over fungi and molds. They grip said prey with powerful arms that split at the elbow into a pair of forearms, giving them four clawed paws. These monstrous brutes are covered with shaggy black fur, often crusted with gore.

Although gugs may seem bestial, they have keen and wicked intellects. Gugs lair far underground, but they sometimes come to the surface to hunt during dark nights, either alone or in small groups. As they possess voracious appetites, most gugs consume the creatures they catch, but some instead kidnap their victims and retreat below the surface, leaving only a lingering stench and odd, clawed paw prints. Victims are taken to rancid lairs marked with strange runes and sacrificed to the gugs’ wicked gods of blood, darkness, and nightmares. Dire rumors tell of lightless gug cities made of titanic blocks of stone far underground, where powerful gug leaders preach their vile doctrines to mobs of howling gugs.

Gugs have a strange relationship with ghouls, which seems to date from their shared origin in a distant subterranean world. Gugs live in fear of ghouls, despite towering over them; however, this strange fear doesn’t apply to ghasts, whom gugs consume as voraciously as they do other creatures.

Gugs stand 16 feet tall and weigh 2,000 pounds, although they have an eerie, graceful gait that belies their immense size. Their light step and ability to squeeze through very small crannies makes gugs common bogeymen in tales of strange disappearances or bloody massacres.

Urevian.name: Urevian
Urevian.description:
Urevian is a phistophilus, or contract devil. These bureaucrats of Hell are rarely found outside the infernal courts, and then almost always to pursue potential contracts, tempting mortals to sell their souls in exchange for achieving their worldly desires. While other contract devils pride themselves on airtight clauses, hidden meanings, and steep penalties to gain the upper hand, Urevian prefers to smile his way into a straightforward deal that’s beneficial to everyone. He’s as kind and generous as he can afford to be toward an opposing party, making them feel like they’re holding all the cards. In a world of snarling fiends and vicious hell-spawn, Urevian seeks to stand out by simply using manners. Devils have a bad reputation for taking advantage of their marks; playing against that is one of Urevian’s strengths, and he uses it to great advantage.

Urevian wants the soul of Carman Rajani. With Belcorra’s return, he can finally escape his agreement with her, but he needs a Rajani soul to do so. Only one such soul remains: the blacksmith and scoundrel who is Vol’s sole remaining descendant. Ideally, Urevian convinces the party to fetch it for him. The contract devil is true to his word, and he departs quickly once he has his prize. The characters might refuse—and, perhaps, should refuse—despite Urevian’s honeyed words. If they fight and defeat him, he isn’t destroyed. Instead, his soul is cast into the court of the powerful entity to whom he pledged the Rajani soul, where he must hastily explain his failure to avoid obliteration.

Urevian spends his time in the room he’s claimed as his personal domain (area G10).

[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .C5GPEqvpV4W3KvBe]]{Detect Magic}, [[/item .8iSXYHTi2fUjMP1I]]{Detect Thoughts}, [[/item .DSwVzwaVpormT5P4]]{Scrying} (only to target a creature with which he has a contract, who makes the saving throw with Disadvantage; to a specific creature named in a contract he has; or to a descendant of any of those creatures), [[/item .J9jze9pSuqNUPsnX]]{Tongues}

2/Day: [[/item .Luw4dXHj8dqJSZhF]]{Sending}

1/Day Each: [[/item .vUvfpq9oFjW5LDtx]]{Enthrall}, [[/item .fOcmFou3l6niPW2O]]{Fireball}, [[/item .Oaq2Rx7b8XzvxDQA]]{Locate Creature} (unlimited range when targeting creatures who returned to life a soul he trapped through a contract), [[/item .n3ccN2aWICU5Q8P8]]{Private Sanctum}, [[/item .BSZooOwaVMu2cNss]]{Silence}, [[/item .CLqyVjNSrN1umbem]]{Wall of Force}

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Scrying.name: Scrying
Scrying.description:
You can see and hear a creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified (see the tables below) by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. The target doesn't know what it is making the save against, only that it feels uneasy.

Your Knowledge of the Target Is …Save Modifier
Secondhand (heard of the target)+5
Firsthand (met the target)+0
Extensive (know the target well)−5
You Have the Target's …Save Modifier
Picture or other likeness−2
Garment or other possession−4
Body part, lock of hair, or bit of nail−10

On a successful save, the target isn't affected, and you can't use this spell on it again for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the spell creates an Invisible, intangible sensor within 10 feet of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. If something can see the sensor, it appears as a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

Instead of targeting a creature, you can target a location you have seen. When you do so, the sensor appears at that location and doesn't move.

materials.value: a focus worth 1,000+ GP, such as a crystal ball, mirror, or water-filled font

affects.special: creature on same plane of existence or a location you have seen
at target location or within 10 feet of target creature

Sending.name: Sending
Sending.description:
You send a short message of 25 words or fewer to a creature you have met or a creature described to you by someone who has met it. The target hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. The spell enables targets to understand the meaning of your message.

You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but if the target is on a different plane than you, there is a 5 percent chance that the message doesn't arrive. You know if the delivery fails.

Upon receiving your message, a creature can block your ability to reach it again with this spell for 8 hours. If you try to send another message during that time, you learn that you are blocked, and the spell fails.

Locate Creature.name: Locate Creature
Locate Creature.description:
Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creature's location if that creature is within 1,000 feet of you. If the creature is moving, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific creature known to you or the nearest creature of a specific kind (such as a human or a unicorn) if you have seen such a creature up close—within 30 feet—at least once. If the creature you described or named is in a different form, such as under the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFleshtoSto]{Flesh to Stone} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph} spell, this spell doesn't locate the creature.

This spell can't locate a creature if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the creature.

Silence.name: Silence
Silence.description: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the Sphere has Immunity to Thunder damage, and creatures have the &Reference[deafened apply=false] condition while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a Verbal component is impossible there.

Silenced.name: Silenced
Silenced.description: Any creature or object entirely inside the Sphere has Immunity to Thunder damage, and creatures have the Deafened condition while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a Verbal component is impossible there.

Wall of Force.name: Wall of Force
Wall of Force.description:
An Invisible wall of force springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose, as a horizontal or vertical barrier or at an angle. It can be free floating or resting on a solid surface. You can form it into a hemispherical dome or a globe with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10-foot-by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1/4 inch thick and lasts for the duration. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (you choose which side).

Nothing can physically pass through the wall. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisintegra]{Disintegrate} spell destroys the wall instantly, however. The wall also extends into the Ethereal Plane and blocks ethereal travel through the wall.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Enthrall.name: Enthrall
Enthrall.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, a target has a −10 penalty to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Distracted.name: Distracted
Distracted.description: The target has a −10 penalty to [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Private Sanctum.name: Private Sanctum
Private Sanctum.description:
You make an area within range magically secure. The area is a Cube that can be as small as 5 feet to as large as 100 feet on each side. The spell lasts for the duration.

When you cast the spell, you decide what sort of security the spell provides, choosing any of the following properties:

  • Sound can't pass through the barrier at the edge of the warded area.
  • The barrier of the warded area appears dark and foggy, preventing vision (including &Reference[Darkvision]) through it.
  • Sensors created by Divination spells can't appear inside the protected area or pass through the barrier at its perimeter.
  • Creatures in the area can't be targeted by Divination spells.
  • Nothing can teleport into or out of the warded area.
  • Planar travel is blocked within the warded area.

Casting this spell on the same spot every day for 365 days makes the spell last until dispelled.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can increase the size of the Cube by 100 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] makes three attacks: two with his [[/item Horns]] and one with his [[/item Quill]].

Quill.name: Quill
Quill.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=HUUfqnfg92sSmmvo]].

Failure: The target has an infernal wound. While the target has a wound, it loses [[/damage average activity=c6gluCPcDt0lh1Qh]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. Each time [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (1d10).

Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful [[/check average]]. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

Foundry Note

Scaling is implemented on the Damage Activity to configure the infernal wound damage each time this attack hits the target. Each scaling value corresponds to the number of hits taken.

save.condition: If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct

Witchfire.name: Witchfire
Witchfire.description:
Manifesting as a sinuous form wreathed in sickly green flames, this incorporeal undead forms when a powerful hag or witch dies in agony or rage. The body at the center of the flames usually resembles the witch’s idealized self-image, regardless of their age and appearance at the time of their death.

A witchfire often resides in a bog or swamp, which slowly blackens and decays around them. These regions are often plagued by will-o’-wisps, which seem to have an uncanny relationship with the resident witchfire. A witchfire might visit villages on the edge of their home terrain to lure away villagers, but always attack victims within earshot to make sure that other villagers hear the screams. A witchfire might also ally with other hags or witches and may even join their covens.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The witchfire can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. They take [[/damage average]] damage if they end their turn inside an object.

Witchflame Curse.name: Witchflame Curse
Witchflame Curse.description: A creature subjected to a Witchflame Curse emits ghostly flames, shedding Dim Light in a 10-foot radius. While cursed with witchflame, the creature can’t benefit from the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition.

affects.special: A creature subjected to a Witchflame Curse

Witchflame Curse.name: Witchflame Curse
Witchflame Curse.description:
When affected by the Witchflame Curse, you shed Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

While cursed with witchflame, you can’t benefit from the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The witchfire makes two attacks.

Witchflame Caress.name: Witchflame Caress
Witchflame Caress.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=6gsDduF7nT8bRi7K]].

Failure: The target is subjected to a [[/item Witchflame Curse]].

Witchflame Bolt.name: Witchflame Bolt
Witchflame Bolt.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=RdDNIm4fUVWEQqYy]].

Failure: The target is subjected to a [[/item Witchflame Curse]].

Witchflame Kindling.name: Witchflame Kindling
Witchflame Kindling.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=9syRr7wLNP1oyU7l]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=9syRr7wLNP1oyU7l]] feet that is subjected to a [[/item Witchflame Curse]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The witchfire casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .KS1zQTPL9pAvs6br]]{Dancing Lights}, [[/item .8kOXdtWI6hsu1eeH]]{Mage Hand}, [[/item .a3YcpSmVuuj4GFVV]]{Minor Illusion}

1/Day: [[/item .0zzhihWOkzu0rgSW]]{Eyebite}

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Eyebite.name: Eyebite
Eyebite.description:
For the duration, your eyes become an inky void. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to target another creature but can't target a creature again if it has succeeded on a save against this casting of the spell.

Asleep. The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Panicked. The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. On each of its turns, the Frightened target must take the &Reference[Dash] action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can't see you, this effect ends.

Sickened. The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition.

affects.special: cannot target a creature that has succeeded on a save against this casting

Asleep.name: Asleep
Asleep.description: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Panicked.name: Panicked
Panicked.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. On each of its turns, the Frightened target must take the &Reference[Dash] action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can’t see you, this effect ends.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description: Legendary Action Uses: 3. Immediately after another creature’s turn, Ysondkhelir can expend a use to take one of the following actions. Ysondkhelir regains all expended uses at the start of each of their turns.

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description: Ysondkhelir uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast Chill Touch.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Ysondkhelir makes a Debilitating Bite attack. Ysondkhelir can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Planar Regeneration.name: Planar Regeneration
Planar Regeneration.description: Ysondkhelir regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of his turns. If reduced to 0 Hit Points, Ysondkhelir’s body dissolves into nothingness, leaving behind his equipment, and he reforms on Leng with all his Hit Points and becomes active again. This trait doesn’t function on Leng or in an area where planar travel doesn’t function.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Ysondkhelir makes one melee attack and uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast a spell.

Debilitating Bite.name: Debilitating Bite
Debilitating Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15.

Failure: The target is cursed until it finishes a Short of Long Rest. While cursed in this way, the creature makes Dexterity-based D20 Tests with Disadvantage.

Debilitated.name: Debilitated
Debilitated.description: The target is cursed until it finishes a Short of Long Rest. While cursed in this way, the creature makes Dexterity-based D20 Tests with Disadvantage.

Spellcasting.description:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplChillTouch]{Chill Touch} (2d10 Necrotic), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMessage000]{Message}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBigbysHand]{Arcane Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDream00000]{Dream}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEyebite000]{Eyebite}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHypnoticPa]{Hypnotic Pattern}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMirrorImag]{Mirror Image}, Outcast’s Curse (page 221), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSuggestion]{Suggestion}

b5TS12l2GFUk98NQ.name: Chill Touch
b5TS12l2GFUk98NQ.description: Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 2d10 Necrotic damage, and it can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Blocked Healing.name: Blocked Healing
Blocked Healing.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell’s school of magic.

Message.name: Message
Message.description:
You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

Blight.name: Blight
Blight.description:
A creature that you can see within range makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A Plant creature automatically fails the save.

Alternatively, target a nonmagical plant that isn’t a creature, such as a tree or shrub. It doesn’t make a save; it simply withers and dies.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object’s location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can’t locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target’s base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Arcane Hand.name: Arcane Hand
Arcane Hand.description:
You create a Large hand of shimmering magical energy in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hand lasts for the duration, and it moves at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hand.

The hand is an object that has AC 20 and Hit Points equal to your Hit Point maximum. If it drops to 0 Hit Points, the spell ends. The hand doesn't occupy its space.

When you cast the spell and as a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the hand up to 60 feet and then cause one of the following effects:

Clenched Fist @Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbsplBigbysHand.Item.phbaoiClenchedFi inline]

Forceful Hand @Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbsplBigbysHand.Item.phbaoiForcefulHa inline]

Interposing Hand @Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbsplBigbysHand.Item.phbaoiInterposin inline]

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage of the Clenched Fist increases by 2d8 and the damage of the Grasping Hand increases by 2d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Dream.name: Dream
Dream.description:
You target a creature you know on the same plane of existence. You or a willing creature you touch enters a trance state to act as a dream messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target’s dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the spell’s duration. The messenger can also shape the dream’s environment, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking.

If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to sleep, at which point the messenger enters its dreams.

You can make the messenger terrifying to the target. If you do so, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words, and then the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and it takes 3d6 Psychic damage when it wakes up.

Trance State.name: Trance State
Trance State.description: While in the trance, the messenger is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0.

Eyebite.name: Eyebite
Eyebite.description:
For the duration, your eyes become an inky void. One creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that you can see must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by one of the following effects of your choice for the duration.

On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to target another creature but can’t target a creature again if it has succeeded on a save against this casting of the spell.

Asleep. The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Panicked. The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. On each of its turns, the Frightened target must take the &Reference[Dash] action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can’t see you, this effect ends.

Sickened. The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition.

affects.special: cannot target a creature that has succeeded on a save against this casting

Asleep.name: Asleep
Asleep.description: The target has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition. It wakes up if it takes any damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Panicked.name: Panicked
Panicked.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. On each of its turns, the Frightened target must take the &Reference[Dash] action and move away from you by the safest and shortest route available. If the target moves to a space at least 60 feet away from you where it can’t see you, this effect ends.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed, the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Hypnotized.name: Hypnotized
Hypnotized.description:
While &Reference[charmed apply=false], the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Mirror Image.name: Mirror Image
Mirror Image.description:
Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it’s impossible to track which image is real.

Each time a creature hits you with an attack roll during the spell’s duration, roll a [[/r (@flags.dnd-players-handbook.mirrorImages)d6kh1cs>2#Duplicate destroyed]]{d6 for each} of your remaining duplicates. If any of the d6s rolls a 3 or higher, one of the duplicates is hit instead of you, and the duplicate is destroyed. The duplicates otherwise ignore all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

A creature is unaffected by this spell if it has the &Reference[blinded apply=false] condition, &Reference[blindsight], or &Reference[truesight].

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, “Fetch the key to the cult’s treasure vault, and give the key to me.” Or you could say, “Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don’t return.”

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Dorianna's Hand.name: Dorianna's Hand
Dorianna's Hand.description: Ysondkhelir moves his Arcane Hand up to 60 feet and creates one of the spell’s effects (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks).

Froghemoth.description: A terrifying abomination of teeth, tentacles, and unbridled rage, the froghemoth is capable of devouring dinosaurs and even dragons. It is a frighteningly effective ambush hunter, immersing itself in the mire with only its eyestalk protruding and watching in every direction at once with uncanny precision.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks: one with its [[/item Bite]] and two with its [[/item Tentacle]]{Tentacles}.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it subject to the following effect.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=pjEfZZbGPU8yL6IQ]].

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] swallows the target. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can swallow one Large creature or two Medium or smaller creatures at a time. A swallowed creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and takes [[/damage average activity=1vurfcvVOl5CQwtI]] damage at the start of each its turns.

If the froghemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=7uDlXZHiJIFHCH5B]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth with the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

If the froghemoth dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Save: 30+ Damage.name: Save: 30+ Damage
Save: 30+ Damage.condition: If the froghemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature

Escape Corpse.name: Escape Corpse
Escape Corpse.condition: Must use 10 feet of movement to escape

Swallowed.name: Swallowed
Swallowed.description: A swallowed creature is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the nightgarm.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: A swallowed creature escaping the stomach of the nightgarm lands &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone}.

Aquatic Ambush.name: Aquatic Ambush
Aquatic Ambush.description:
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is underwater and hidden from a creature within 20 feet of it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] Swims up to 20 feet and makes a [[/item Bite]] attack against that creature.

The froghemoth has Advantage on the attack roll.

Lashing Tongue.description:
