Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] lashes out its tongue at the attacker.

Failure: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls the creature to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it and makes a [[/item Bite]] attack against it.

save.condition: A creature the froghemoth can see within 15 feet of it misses the froghemoth with an attack.

[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Electric Torpor.description:
Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Lightning damage, it takes no damage but is slowed until the end of its next turn.

While slowed, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t take Reactions and can’t use [[/item Multiattack]], and its Speed is halved.

Slowed.name: Slowed
Slowed.description: Whenever the froghemoth is subjected to Lightning damage, can’t take Reactions and can’t use Multiattack, and its Speed is halved.

Otherworldly Vision.name: Otherworldly Vision
Otherworldly Vision.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s stalked eyes allow it to see in all directions at once. It has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

It can see Invisible creatures and objects, as well as into the Ethereal Plane, out to a range of 30 feet.

It automatically sees through visual illusions within 30 feet of it.

Prodigious Leap.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Long Jump is up to 20 feet, and its High Jump is up to 10 feet with or without a running start.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Caligni Creeper.name: Caligni Creeper
Caligni Creeper.description: The mischievous caligni creepers are the calignis most commonly encountered by surface folk.

Sneak Attack.description: The caligni deals an extra 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the caligni that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the caligni doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Death Flare.description:
The caligni combusts in a flash of bright light when it dies.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=LC8fOhtpD4eyJGCx]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=LC8fOhtpD4eyJGCx]]-foot Emanation originating from the caligni. Creatures with the [[/item Sunlight Sensitivity]] trait make the save with Disadvantage.

The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog's radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description:
A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 Cold damage, and its Speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Reduced Movement.name: Reduced Movement
Reduced Movement.description: The target's Speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Divination.name: Divination
Divination.description:
This spell puts you in contact with a god or a god's servants. You ask one question about a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply, which might be a short phrase or cryptic rhyme. The spell doesn't account for circumstances that might change the answer, such as the casting of other spells.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: incense worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes

Haste.name: Haste
Haste.description:
Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's Speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to Armor Class, it has Advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used to take only the Attack (one attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Utilize action.

When the spell ends, the target is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0 until the end of its next turn, as a wave of lethargy washes over it.

Hasted.name: Hasted
Hasted.description:
Until the spell ends, the target’s Speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to Armor Class, it has Advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used to take only the Attack (one attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Utilize action.

When the spell ends, the target is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0 until the end of its next turn, as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHaste00000.ActiveEffect.S5XcFawnnNHO8bUr]{wave of lethargy} washes over it.

Lethargy.name: Lethargy
Lethargy.description: When the spell ends, the target is &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0 until the end of its next turn, as a wave of lethargy washes over it.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, "Fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don't return."

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Vampiric Touch.name: Vampiric Touch
Vampiric Touch.description:
The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 Necrotic damage, and you regain Hit Points equal to half the amount of Necrotic damage dealt.

Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as a Magic action, targeting the same creature or a different one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

Potion of Greater Healing.name: Potion of Greater Healing
Potion of Greater Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 4d4+4 hit points when you drink this potion.

Potion of Heroism.name: Potion of Heroism
Potion of Heroism.description:
This blue potion bubbles and steams as if boiling.

For 1 hour after drinking it, you gain 10 temporary hit points that last for 1 hour. For the same duration, you are under the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.8dzaICjGy6mTUaUr]{Bless} spell (no concentration required)

Foundry Note

The Other Formula button can be used to roll the bonus 1d4 received from Bless.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description:
&Reference[Difficult Terrain] caused by swampy terrain doesn’t cost the [[lookup @name]] extra movement.

The [[lookup @name]] has a +3 bonus to Stealth checks made in swamps.

Foundry Note

An Active Effect (AE) is available to be enabled in the Effects tab of this actor sheet.

+3 Stealth Check.name: +3 Stealth Check
+3 Stealth Check.description: The creature has a +3 bonus to Stealth checks made in swamps.

Gnomish Cunning.name: Gnomish Cunning
Gnomish Cunning.description: The [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

Ambusher.name: Ambusher
Ambusher.description: In the first round of a combat, the [[lookup @name]] has Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that began the combat surprised.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Child of Belcorra uses [[/item .5VlVFK5Rc2ADChrC]] and makes one [[/item .4frM1mB52j0b7BlB]] attack.

Breathtaking Glare.name: Breathtaking Glare
Breathtaking Glare.description:
The [[lookup @name]] targets one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] they can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] feet of them. If the target can see the Child, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]].

Failure: The target can’t breathe or speak. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name]]'s Breathtaking Glare for the next 24 hours.

affects.special: Affected by the creature's Breathtaking Glare

Breathtaking Glare.name: Breathtaking Glare
Breathtaking Glare.description: The creature can’t breathe or speak. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Rotting Fist.name: Rotting Fist
Rotting Fist.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is cursed.

While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse.

A creature dies and decays into a foul-smelling sludge if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can’t regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .EtEgRdgwmc2jSc1j]]{Druidcraft}, [[/item .UWqa2I78Yx2JjBt7]]{Poison Spray} (2d12 Poison damage), [[/item .NNq6IVhB06bNb27b]]{Produce Flame} (2d8 Fire damage)

2/Day Each: [[/item .XDe7QPecfzzVhjkw]]{Barkskin}, [[/item .iuGiDuZrKTjDKf51]]{Entangle}, [[/item .1ZqBVOWrOTaOdMZn]]{Faerie Fire}, [[/item .jdLOKZmG6rmontp0]]{Meld into Stone}, [[/item .2jTSc3eMdyo3SAxz]]{Moonbeam}, [[/item .MVCymniq01Qf7RPj]]{Pass Without Trace}, [[/item .g9s4GEPVxocCcMn8]]{Plant Growth}, [[/item .AIIn8PZ7Pe69O7Mr]]{Protection from Energy}, [[/item .SXuHVkhSXO17posY]]{Spike Growth}

1/Day Each: [[/item .aYRmAKQ9TiVXQEEp]]{Conjure Minor Elementals}, [[/item .GLyJ83o0J9CWmTFN]]{Freedom of Movement}

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Poison Spray.name: Poison Spray
Poison Spray.description:
You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 Poison damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d12 when you reach levels 5 (2d12), 11 (3d12), and 17 (4d12).

Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
Produce Flame.description:
A flickering flame appears in your hand and remains there for the duration. While there, the flame emits no heat and ignites nothing, and it sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to hurl fire at a creature or an object within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Fire damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Barkskin.name: Barkskin
Barkskin.description: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin assumes a bark-like appearance, and the target has an Armor Class of 17 if its AC is lower than that.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Meld into Stone.name: Meld into Stone
Meld into Stone.description:
You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, merging yourself and your equipment with the stone for the duration. You must touch the stone to do so. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.

While merged with the stone, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with Disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the stone. You can use 5 feet of movement to leave the stone where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.

Minor physical damage to the stone doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals [[/damage 6d6 type=force]] damage to you. The stone's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals [[/damage 50 type=force]] damage to you. If expelled, you move into an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered and have the &Reference[prone] condition.

Moonbeam.name: Moonbeam
Moonbeam.description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the Cylinder, and you can take a Magic action on later turns to move the Cylinder up to 60 feet.

When the Cylinder appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 Radiant damage, and if the creature is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example), it reverts to its true form and can't shape-shift until it leaves the Cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the spell's area moves into its space and when it enters the spell's area or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 2.

Pass without Trace.name: Pass without Trace
Pass without Trace.description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Concealed.name: Concealed
Concealed.description: While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Plant Growth.name: Plant Growth
Plant Growth.description:
Casting Time: Action (Overgrowth) or 8 hours (Enrichment)

This spell channels vitality into plants. The casting time you use determines whether the spell has the Overgrowth or the Enrichment effect below.

Overgrowth. Choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through that area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

Enrichment. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 365 days. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested. They can benefit from only one Plant Growth per year.

Protection from Energy.name: Protection from Energy
Protection from Energy.description: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has Resistance to one damage type of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

Spike Growth.name: Spike Growth
Spike Growth.description:
The ground in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes Difficult Terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes [[/damage 2d4 type=piercing]] damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area when the spell is cast must take a Search action and succeed on a [[/check ability=wis skill=prc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] or [[/check ability=wis skill=sur dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

Conjure Minor Elementals.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
Conjure Minor Elementals.description:
You conjure spirits from the Elemental Planes that flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. Until the spell ends, any attack you make deals an extra 2d8 damage when you hit a creature in the Emanation. This damage is Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (your choice when you make the attack).

In addition, the ground in the Emanation is &Reference[DifficultTerrain] for your enemies.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

Freedom of Movement.name: Freedom of Movement
Freedom of Movement.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's movement is unaffected by &Reference[DifficultTerrain], and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's Speed nor cause the target to have the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] or &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions. The target also has a Swim Speed equal to its Speed.

In addition, the target can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature imposing the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition on it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Foundry Note

The Active Effect provided by the Cast activity upgrades the character's Swim Speed to a value of "1" to indicate equivalence to (walk) Speed, in addition to the condition immunities.

Death Aura.name: Death Aura
Death Aura.description:
Creatures have Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws while within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=JDZr04dv14VlYWuz]] feet of the bodak.

A humanoid that dies within [[lookup @range.value activity=5gEkxnRxFn9Jcd4p]] feet of the bodak rises as an autonomous Bodak after 24 hours.

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the bodak has Disadvantage on D20 Tests. If the bodak ends its turn in sunlight, they gain 1 level of Exhaustion. The bodak recovers 1 level of Exhaustion each minute it spends in Darkness.

Detect Life.name: Detect Life

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target’s Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Draining Glance.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=kFyuof0SS3nohP0f]], one creature the bodak can see within 30 feet, Constructs and Undead are immune to this effect.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Ogre Spider.description: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants. The placement of their eyes above their wide mandibles evokes the grimacing visage of an ogre’s leer.

[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed

2/Day Each: [[/item .ION3NSEiBzpZ9MKt]]{Barkskin} , [[/item .GVsxsCVFCOTdbwcZ]]{Entangle} , [[/item .r61zmm2CtSnZo8lH]]{Faerie Fire} , [[/item .41vmBNdUhmIM9Bei]]{Meld into Stone} , [[/item .sctgOhWAPxNxBCVq]]{Moonbeam} , [[/item .UMQ836Hr6KVV9t1J]]{Pass Without Trace} , [[/item .EmyuI7H9Q6c2ZgqG]]{Plant Growth} , [[/item .5BJmFOA2pFDGMqaP]]{Protection from Energy} , [[/item .Z6WDbw3Lfud4kJDt]]{Spike Growth}

1/Day Each: [[/item .bJzhpKRargXPkrDJ]]{Conjure Minor Elementals} , [[/item .hiplqPjBy2aK8IIN]]{Freedom of Movement}

Poison Spray.name: Poison Spray
Poison Spray.description:
You spray toxic mist at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 Poison damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d12 when you reach levels 5 (2d12), 11 (3d12), and 17 (4d12).

Barkskin.name: Barkskin
Barkskin.description: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin assumes a bark-like appearance, and the target has an Armor Class of 17 if its AC is lower than that.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Produce Flame.name: Produce Flame
Produce Flame.description:
A flickering flame appears in your hand and remains there for the duration. While there, the flame emits no heat and ignites nothing, and it sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Until the spell ends, you can take a Magic action to hurl fire at a creature or an object within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Fire damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d8 when you reach levels 5 (2d8), 11 (3d8), and 17 (4d8).

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Pass without Trace.name: Pass without Trace
Pass without Trace.description: You radiate a concealing aura in a 30-foot Emanation for the duration. While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Concealed.name: Concealed
Concealed.description: While in the aura, you and each creature you choose have a +10 bonus to [[/check ability=dex skill=ste]] checks and leave no tracks.

Meld into Stone.name: Meld into Stone
Meld into Stone.description:
You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, merging yourself and your equipment with the stone for the duration. You must touch the stone to do so. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.

While merged with the stone, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with Disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the stone. You can use 5 feet of movement to leave the stone where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.

Minor physical damage to the stone doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals [[/damage 6d6 type=force]] damage to you. The stone's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals [[/damage 50 type=force]] damage to you. If expelled, you move into an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered and have the &Reference[prone] condition.

Plant Growth.name: Plant Growth
Plant Growth.description:
Casting Time: Action (Overgrowth) or 8 hours (Enrichment)

This spell channels vitality into plants. The casting time you use determines whether the spell has the Overgrowth or the Enrichment effect below.

Overgrowth. Choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point become thick and overgrown. A creature moving through that area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves. You can exclude one or more areas of any size within the spell's area from being affected.

Enrichment. All plants in a half-mile radius centered on a point within range become enriched for 365 days. The plants yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested. They can benefit from only one Plant Growth per year.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Protection from Energy.name: Protection from Energy
Protection from Energy.description: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has Resistance to one damage type of your choice: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

Moonbeam.name: Moonbeam
Moonbeam.description:
A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the Cylinder, and you can take a Magic action on later turns to move the Cylinder up to 60 feet.

When the Cylinder appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 Radiant damage, and if the creature is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example), it reverts to its true form and can't shape-shift until it leaves the Cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the spell's area moves into its space and when it enters the spell's area or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 2.

Freedom of Movement.name: Freedom of Movement
Freedom of Movement.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's movement is unaffected by &Reference[DifficultTerrain], and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's Speed nor cause the target to have the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] or &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions. The target also has a Swim Speed equal to its Speed.

In addition, the target can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature imposing the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition on it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Spike Growth.name: Spike Growth
Spike Growth.description:
The ground in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes Difficult Terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes [[/damage 2d4 type=piercing]] damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area when the spell is cast must take a Search action and succeed on a [[/check ability=wis skill=prc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] or [[/check ability=wis skill=sur dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

Conjure Minor Elementals.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
Conjure Minor Elementals.description:
You conjure spirits from the Elemental Planes that flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. Until the spell ends, any attack you make deals an extra 2d8 damage when you hit a creature in the Emanation. This damage is Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning (your choice when you make the attack).

In addition, the ground in the Emanation is &Reference[DifficultTerrain] for your enemies.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 4.

Huglu.name: Huglu
Huglu.description: Other urdefhans scorn the death scouts’ stealthy methods, but none can argue with their results.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The urdefhan casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .QfuhtIMoCXhk7YXT]]{Feather Fall}

1/Day Each: [[/item .UvQ94QkZLLjviXV8]]{Invisibility} , [[/item .5rJpDS8LtebrJAfG]]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
If the urdefhan has hit a creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead with a [[/item Shauth Blade]] attack this turn, the urdefhan drinks the creature’s blood from the blade.

The urdefhan regains [[/heal average]] (Hit Points).

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The urdefhan makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Shauth Blade]] attack.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When the urdefhan dies, their flesh sublimates into noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=XmYRlblDdgIYxu6e]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=XmYRlblDdgIYxu6e]]-foot Emanation originating from the urdefhan.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=WWjBvQK80oya2jJZ]].

Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by [[/r 1d10#HP Max Decrease]]{5 (1d10)} Hit Points, and the urdefhan regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

affects.special: That isn’t an Undead or Construct

HP Max Reduction.name: HP Max Reduction
HP Max Reduction.condition: If the target fails their save

Shauth Blade.name: Shauth Blade
Shauth Blade.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the urdefhan scores a Critical Hit, the target takes an extra [[/damage average activity=FOO]] damage. This damage isn’t doubled.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

activation.condition: when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you falls

materials.value: a small feather or piece of down

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Iribo.name: Iribo
Iribo.description: Drow who specialize in the repeating hand crossbow command respect for their skill and swagger.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .dUSpvaFg6W4JXLqE]]{Dancing Lights}

1/Day Each: [[/item .fuMxlcXWHAd1bexI]]{Darkness} , [[/item .7bV7uJlL92Qwi7UB]]{Faerie Fire}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow attacks twice with their [[/item Elven Curve Blade]] or twice with their [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]].

Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow
Repeating Hand Crossbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains Poisoned. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains &Reference[Poisoned apply=false].

Shootist’s Bandolier.name: Shootist’s Bandolier
Shootist’s Bandolier.description: The drow reloads their repeating hand crossbow.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The drow deals an extra 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the drow doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Indomitable.name: Indomitable
Indomitable.description: If the drow fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Saves +5.name: Saves +5
Saves +5.description: If the drow fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Reload Trick.name: Reload Trick
Reload Trick.description: If the drow’s [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]] is empty, they reload it and make one attack with it. If the target hasn’t seen the drow use Reload Trick before, the drow makes the attack with Advantage.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: [[lookup @name]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Spider's Sting.name: Spider's Sting
Spider's Sting.description:
Injury Poison

A creature subjected to Lolth's Sting must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have the &reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, the creature also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Krooth.name: Krooth
Krooth.description: Krooths, sometimes called crocodile eaters, are fast and vicious bogland hunters. While they are known to hunt and eat large predators, their favorite prey are lizardfolk, boggards, and dinosaurs. Indeed, a krooth looks vaguely like a dinosaur itself, with its ridged head frill, long tail, and mouth full of sharp, venomous teeth. When a krooth bites a creature, one of these teeth breaks off and embeds itself in the victim’s flesh.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks: one with its [[/item Bite]] and one with its [[/item Tail Spike]].

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

If the target is a creature, one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Poisoned teeth breaks off and embeds itself in the target’s flesh. While the tooth remains embedded, the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition.

The target or a creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to remove the tooth, ending the Poisoned condition.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: If the target is a creature, one of the krooth's poisoned teeth breaks off and embeds itself in the target’s flesh. While the tooth remains embedded, the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition.

Pain Frenzy.name: Pain Frenzy
Pain Frenzy.description:
Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to a Critical Hit.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a [[/item Tail Spike]] attack.

Use.name: Use
Use.condition: The krooth is subjected to a Critical Hit.

Fearless.name: Fearless
Fearless.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Frightened condition.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

JkJRKxuIGJ3DOD9L.description:
Wraith

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Life Drain.name: Life Drain
Life Drain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Create Specter.name: Create Specter
Create Specter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets a Humanoid corpse within [[lookup @range.value activity=ypIQdXr13u7LATUP]] feet of itself that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The target's spirit rises as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmSpecter0000000]{Specter} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than seven specters under its control at a time.

Padli.name: Padli
Padli.description: Priests aid caligni custodians in managing a congregation of caligni worshipers. They rarely have true divine power, instead leveraging occult abilities.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The caligni casts one of the following spells, using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +[[lookup @attributes.spell.attack]] to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: [[/item .LKemCcQiDoQ0aCFK]]{Chill Touch} , [[/item .a0zCfttyFumNTyk3]]{Darkness} , [[/item .niFxvqwcZ9uoc8k0]]{Detect Magic} , [[/item .0732TwDiyzQjhcmZ]]{Fog Cloud}

2/Day Each: [[/item .laj0pCFqIBSQnPAc]]{Shield}

1/Day Each: [[/item .EkCT03ZfNCyNuIr4]]{Blindness/Deafness} , [[/item .sdr1RYcNHO4IqJOa]]{Enthrall} , [[/item .hBmWX6UTr73DYzBC]]{Hold Person} , [[/item .gOjBNu9Bpsx2OTvl]]{Invisibility} , [[/item .WyocrD5rfWDZgtNk]]{Suggestion}

Occult Ward.name: Occult Ward
Occult Ward.description:
Trigger: The caligni fails a saving throw against a spell.

Response: The caligni draws a simple icon in the air and adds 3 to the result of their save, possibly causing the save to succeed.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The caligni makes two [[/item Dagger]] attacks.

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog's radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Enthrall.name: Enthrall
Enthrall.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, a target has a −10 penalty to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Distracted.name: Distracted
Distracted.description: The target has a −10 penalty to [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Chill Touch.name: Chill Touch
Chill Touch.description:
Channeling the chill of the grave, make a melee spell attack against a target within reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

Blocked Healing.name: Blocked Healing
Blocked Healing.description: The target can’t regain Hit Points until the end of your next turn.

Suggestion.name: Suggestion
Suggestion.description:
You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, "Fetch the key to the cult's treasure vault, and give the key to me." Or you could say, "Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don't return."

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Pursuing Suggestion.name: Pursuing Suggestion
Pursuing Suggestion.description: The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The drow deals an extra 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the drow doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Death Flare.name: Death Flare
Death Flare.description:
The caligni explodes in a burst of chilling shadow when it dies.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=yekDKOgvxkYJYpGu]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=yekDKOgvxkYJYpGu]]-foot Emanation originating from the caligni.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Anything the caligni is wearing or carrying falls to the ground unharmed.

save.condition: When the caligni dies

Potion of Clairvoyance.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
Potion of Clairvoyance.description:
An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} spell.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Tentacle]] attacks, uses [[/item Reel]], and makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description:
[[/attack extended]]. Hit: The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of six tentacles, and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

The tentacle can be damaged, freeing a creature it has Grappled when destroyed (AC 20, HP 10, Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). Damaging the tentacle deals no damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and a destroyed tentacle regrows at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Grappled.name: Grappled
Grappled.description:
Escape Tests (see origin item for DC)

Reel.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] pulls each creature Grappled by it up to 30 feet straight toward it.

Fiendish Restoration.name: Fiendish Restoration
Fiendish Restoration.description: If it dies, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] returns to life in [[/r 1d6]] days and regains all its Hit Points. Only a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] or [[/item .mmNecroticRay000]] in any combination.

Bite.name: Bite

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWaterBreat]{Water Breathing}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDimensionD]{Dimension Door}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person} (level 3), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (level 4)

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Water Breathing.name: Water Breathing
Water Breathing.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport to a location within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "300 feet upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle."

You can also teleport one willing creature. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you teleport, and it teleports to a space within 5 feet of your destination space.

If you, the other creature, or both would arrive in a space occupied by a creature or completely filled by one or more objects, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 Force damage, and the teleportation fails.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:

Cavern Distortion.name: Cavern Distortion
Cavern Distortion.description: The drow raises a hand and magically causes pebbles and dust to rise from the ground to surround the drow and each creature they choose within 60 feet of them. Attacks against an affected creature are made with Disadvantage. The effect lasts for 1 minute or until the drow’s &Reference[Concentration] on the effect ends.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The drow has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition. Magic can’t put them to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Underground Stride.name: Underground Stride
Underground Stride.description: While the drow is underground, Difficult Terrain caused by rubble or uneven ground doesn’t cost them extra movement.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

Resistance.name: Resistance
Resistance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a damage type: Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing, Poison, Radiant, Slashing, or Thunder. When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by 1d4. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Acid Protection.name: Acid Protection
Acid Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Bludgeoning Protection.name: Bludgeoning Protection
Bludgeoning Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Cold Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.
