Thunder Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Spare the Dying.name: Spare the Dying
Spare the Dying.description:
Choose a creature within range that has 0 Hit Points and isn't dead. The creature becomes Stable.

Cantrip Upgrade. The range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Booming Voice.name: Booming Voice
Booming Voice.description: Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Aid.name: Aid
Aid.description:
Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's Hit Point maximum and current Hit Points increase by 5 for the duration.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Each target's Hit Points increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 2.

Level 2: +5 Max HP.name: Level 2: +5 Max HP
Level 2: +5 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 3: +10 Max HP.name: Level 3: +10 Max HP
Level 3: +10 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 4: +15 Max HP.name: Level 4: +15 Max HP
Level 4: +15 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 5: +20 Max HP.name: Level 5: +20 Max HP
Level 5: +20 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 6: +25 Max HP.name: Level 6: +25 Max HP
Level 6: +25 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 7: +30 Max HP.name: Level 7: +30 Max HP
Level 7: +30 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 8: +35 Max HP.name: Level 8: +35 Max HP
Level 8: +35 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 9: +40 Max HP.name: Level 9: +40 Max HP
Level 9: +40 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Augury.name: Augury
Augury.description:
You receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses the omen from the Omens table.

OmenFor Results That Will Be …
WealGood
WoeBad
Weal and woeGood and bad
IndifferenceNeither good nor bad

The spell doesn't account for circumstances, such as other spells, that might change the results.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: specially marked sticks, bones, cards, or other divinatory tokens worth 25+ GP

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Divination.name: Divination
Divination.description:
This spell puts you in contact with a god or a god's servants. You ask one question about a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply, which might be a short phrase or cryptic rhyme. The spell doesn't account for circumstances that might change the answer, such as the casting of other spells.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: incense worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes

Guardian of Faith.name: Guardian of Faith
Guardian of Faith.description:
A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The guardian occupies that space and is invulnerable, and it appears in a form appropriate for your deity or pantheon.

Any enemy that moves to a space within 10 feet of the guardian for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 20 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The guardian vanishes when it has dealt a total of 60 damage.

Locate Object.name: Locate Object
Locate Object.description:
Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object's location if that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement.

The spell can locate a specific object known to you if you have seen it up close—within 30 feet—at least once. Alternatively, the spell can locate the nearest object of a particular kind, such as a certain kind of apparel, jewelry, furniture, tool, or weapon.

This spell can't locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
Protective spirits flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Any other creature's Speed is halved in the Emanation, and whenever the Emanation enters a creature's space and whenever a creature enters the Emanation or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 Radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 Necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 3.

Half Speed.name: Half Speed
Half Speed.description: The creature's speed is halved while within the Emanation.

Stone Shape.name: Stone Shape
Stone Shape.description: You touch a stone object of Medium size or smaller or a section of stone no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape you like. For example, you could shape a large rock into a weapon, statue, or coffer, or you could make a small passage through a wall that is 5 feet thick. You could also shape a stone door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

Commune.name: Commune
Commune.description:
You contact a deity or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.

Divine beings aren't necessarily omniscient, so you might receive "unclear" as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the deity's knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the deity's interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

Contagion.name: Contagion
Contagion.description:
Your touch inflicts a magical contagion. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 11d8 Necrotic damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. While Poisoned, the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends on the target. If the target fails three of the saves, the spell lasts for 7 days on it.

Whenever the Poisoned target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]], or the Poisoned condition doesn't end on it.

Infected (Strength).name: Infected (Strength)
Infected (Strength).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Infected (Dexterity).name: Infected (Dexterity)
Infected (Dexterity).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Infected (Constitution).name: Infected (Constitution)
Infected (Constitution).description:
• While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has Disadvantage on saving throws made with the chosen ability.

  • The target must repeat the [[/save ability=con format=long]] at the end of each of its turns until it gets three successes or failures.

  • Whenever the target receives an effect that would end the Poisoned condition, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=con format=long]], or the condition doesn’t end on it.

Legend Lore.name: Legend Lore
Legend Lore.description:
Name or describe a famous person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about that famous thing, as described by the DM.

The lore might consist of important details, amusing revelations, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. The more information you already know about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is. That information is accurate but might be couched in figurative language or poetry, as determined by the DM.

If the famous thing you chose isn't actually famous, you hear sad musical notes played on a trombone, and the spell fails.

materials.value: incense worth 250+ GP, which the spell consumes, and four ivory strips worth 50+ GP each

Mass Cure Wounds.name: Mass Cure Wounds
Mass Cure Wounds.description:
A wave of healing energy washes out from a point you can see within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each target regains Hit Points equal to 5d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

Curtain of Stone.name: Curtain of Stone
Curtain of Stone.description:
Trigger: The drow is hit by an attack roll while touching a stone surface.

Response: The drow adds 5 to their AC against the triggering attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Bright Walker.name: Bright Walker
Bright Walker.description:
Those who have encountered calignis (page 229) quickly learn that their method of death involves burning out instead of bleeding out. At times, this dramatic immolation is denied to a caligni and they arise as an undead bright walker. This moniker is a bit of a misnomer, because these undead don’t walk; they instead float a few inches above the ground. Though tied to caligni society, bright walkers don’t understand that their glow damages and repels living calignis.

Most calignis assume that bright walkers arise at the whims of their capricious demigods, the Forsaken, but as the Forsaken are denied the souls of these undead, some other unknown force must be involved.

Bright Release.name: Bright Release
Bright Release.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] explodes in a bright flash of light [[lookup @activation.condition activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]].

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=1SfqWSp7RSyHgG4b]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Creatures with Sunlight Sensitivity make the save with Disadvantage.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: Magical Darkness that overlaps with the Emanation is dispelled.

save.condition: when it dies

Brilliant Illumination.name: Brilliant Illumination
Brilliant Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 60-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 60 feet. The bright walker can suppress or reignite this light as a Bonus Action.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Landbound.name: Landbound
Landbound.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t fly higher than a foot above the ground. If they fly higher than this distance, they fall but don’t take damage from falling.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .RV6FEJZ0Wspq5BV1]] attacks or two [[/item .xs0eHq5svLGXMmln]] attacks.

Radiant Ray.name: Radiant Ray
Radiant Ray.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

On a Critical Hit, the target also has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Critical Hit: Blinded.name: Critical Hit: Blinded
Critical Hit: Blinded.description: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Reignite.name: Reignite
Reignite.description:
If the bright walker’s Brilliant Illumination is suppressed, the bright walker reignites it with a blast of heat and light.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]]-foot Emanation originating from the bright walker. Creatures with Sunlight Sensitivity make the save with Disadvantage.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the creature has the Blinded condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: Magical Darkness that overlaps with this area is dispelled.

Shadow Jump.name: Shadow Jump
Shadow Jump.description: If the bright walker’s Brilliant Illumination is suppressed, the bright walker teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that is in an area of Dim Light or Darkness.

range.special: unoccupied space that is in an area of Dim Light or Darkness

Caligni Defender.name: Caligni Defender
Caligni Defender.description: Caligni defenders protect caligni enclaves and travelers.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The caligni makes one [[/item Shortsword]] attack and one [[/item Dagger]] attack. Alternatively, they make two [[/item Shortbow]] attacks.

Protective Shove.name: Protective Shove
Protective Shove.description:
Trigger: A willing ally within 5 feet of the caligni is hit by a melee attack roll.

Response: The caligni adds 3 to the AC of their ally, possibly causing the triggering attack to miss. The caligni can then move their ally up to 5 feet or give them the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Death Flare.name: Death Flare
Death Flare.description:
The caligni combusts in white-hot flames when it dies.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=raxPS7WJTDJDVkLG]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=raxPS7WJTDJDVkLG]]-foot Emanation originating from the caligni.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Anything the caligni is wearing or carrying falls to the ground unharmed.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The caligni casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .PAVoVKgWRyxaHx6e]]{Darkness} , [[/item .4FAUuh7K71wcRRrA]]{Detect Magic} , [[/item .Qjw1STQar554fs1C]]{Fog Cloud}

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog's radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The caligni deals an extra 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the caligni that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the caligni doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, the caligni has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that automatically grants disadvantage to ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply advantage to attack rolls at this time. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Warbling Song.name: Warbling Song
Warbling Song.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] gives a strange, ululating cry that causes nearby creatures to lash out violently and without control.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]], each [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=dxxqZP7Vo01te3QB]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Creatures immune to the Charmed condition automatically succeed on the save.

Failure: The target can’t take Reactions until the end of its next turn, and the target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does on its next turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a random creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

Success: The target is immune to Warbling Song for 1 minute.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a random creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

Staccato Strike.name: Staccato Strike
Staccato Strike.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses subtle alterations in the pitch and tone of its song to direct one creature affected by its [[/item .qLiOxBPkgnCEsLHh]]. If that creature can hear the [[lookup @name lowercase]], it makes a melee attack against a creature within its reach chosen by the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Hop-Dodge.name: Hop-Dodge
Hop-Dodge.description:
Trigger: A creature the cauthooj can see targets it with a melee attack.

Response: The cauthooj chooses another creature within 5 feet of them. That creature becomes the target of the triggering attack, and the cauthooj moves up to half their Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Drawn to Service.name: Drawn to Service
Drawn to Service.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that would compel them to serve a master outside Abaddon.

The cost of Material components and payment required for @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlanarAlly]{Planar Ally}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlanarBind]{Planar Binding}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGate000000]{Gate}, and similar spells are reduced by half if the only target is a ceustodaemon.

Grappled and Restrained.description:
f the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
Flame Breath.description:

Failure: [[/damage average activity=qNI6W02jCUQbPpYE]] damage, and the target catches fire. While on fire, the target takes [[/damage average activity=H1RiXv4iVx1DOdGL]] damage at the end of each of its turns. Any can use an action to extinguish the flames.

Success: Half damage only.

Flame Breath.name: Flame Breath
Flame Breath.description: While on fire, the target takes [[/r 1d10]] Fire damage at the end of each of its turns. Any can use an action to extinguish the flames.

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport to a location within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "300 feet upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle."

You can also teleport one willing creature. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you teleport, and it teleports to a space within 5 feet of your destination space.

If you, the other creature, or both would arrive in a space occupied by a creature or completely filled by one or more objects, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 Force damage, and the teleportation fails.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Bound.name: Bound
Bound.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is magically bound to an amulet. While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to travel to it, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is within 60 feet of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (round up) is transferred to the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Spell Storing.name: Spell Storing
Spell Storing.description: A spellcaster who wears the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s amulet can cause the [[lookup @name lowercase]] to store one spell of level 4 or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while within 5 feet of it. The spell has no effect but is stored within the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. Any previously stored spell is lost when a new spell is stored. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can cast the spell stored with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no spell components and using the caster's spellcasting ability. The stored spell is then lost.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Fist]] attacks.

Protection.name: Protection
Protection.description:
Trigger: An attack roll hits the wearer of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s amulet while the wearer is within 5 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Response: The wearer gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack and possibly causing it to miss, until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

utility.condition: An attack roll hits the wearer of the guardian's amulet while the wearer is within 5 feet of the guardian

Protected.name: Protected
Protected.description: The wearer gains a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack and possibly causing it to miss, until the start of the bestower's next turn.

Deepwater Dhuthorex.name: Deepwater Dhuthorex
Deepwater Dhuthorex.description: The typical dhuthorex is a hungry and thoughtless beast, chasing prey through the depths and venturing onto land only to pursue easy prey.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dhuthorex makes two attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] or [[/item Snout]], and one with their [[/item Tentacle]].

Snout.name: Snout
Snout.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mQbR0q9X9zd8XpU0]].

Failure: The dhuthorex pushes the target up to 10 feet or gives them the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition (dhuthorex’s choice).

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 15).

Aquatic Ambush.name: Aquatic Ambush
Aquatic Ambush.description:
If the dhuthorex is underwater and hidden from a creature within 20 feet of them, the dhuthorex Swims up to 20 feet and makes a [[/item Bite]] attack against that creature.

The dhuthorex has Advantage on the attack roll.

Wavesense.name: Wavesense
Wavesense.description: The dhuthorex can’t use their Tremorsense outside of water.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack they are grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the Grapple ends.

While swallowed, the target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has &Reference[total cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and it takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone} in a space within [[lookup @range.value activity=uygphpszavIkHznS]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using [[lookup @range.value activity=uygphpszavIkHznS]] feet of movement, exiting &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone}.

Save: 20+ Damage.name: Save: 20+ Damage
Save: 20+ Damage.condition: If the dhuthorex takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature

Damage: While Swallowed.name: Damage: While Swallowed
Damage: While Swallowed.condition: If a creature is swallowed by the gug

Escape Corpse.name: Escape Corpse
Escape Corpse.condition: Must use 10 feet of movement to escape

Swallowed.name: Swallowed
Swallowed.description: While swallowed, the target is &Reference[blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has &Reference[total cover] against attacks and other effects outside the creature.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: A swallowed creature escaping the stomach lands &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone}.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Tearing Rend.name: Tearing Rend
Tearing Rend.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hits the same creature with two or more [[/item Claw]]{claws} on the same turn, they deal that creature an additional [[/damage average]] damage.

affects.special: that the derghodaemon has hit witch two or more claws on the same turn

Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Dimension Door.name: Dimension Door
Dimension Door.description:
You teleport to a location within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction, such as "200 feet straight downward" or "300 feet upward to the northwest at a 45-degree angle."

You can also teleport one willing creature. The creature must be within 5 feet of you when you teleport, and it teleports to a space within 5 feet of your destination space.

If you, the other creature, or both would arrive in a space occupied by a creature or completely filled by one or more objects, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 Force damage, and the teleportation fails.

Insect Plague.name: Insect Plague
Insect Plague.description:
Swarming locusts fill a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The Sphere remains for the duration, and its area is &Reference[LightlyObscured] and &Reference[DifficultTerrain].

When the swarm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or that target can't take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Sphere's radius increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Confused.name: Confused
Confused.description:
The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Dread Wisp.name: Dread Wisp
Dread Wisp.description:
Will-o’-wisps native to the Darklands are more ominous and malevolent than those that bob about in the lonely marshes and surfaces of the upper world. These dread wisps instill terror with eerie shifts of light and consume the fear they create, drawing life energy from their victims in the process. While dread wisps can survive anywhere in the Darklands, they prefer moist areas like partially submerged caves, the banks of underground rivers, and towering fungus gardens.

Dread wisps don’t glow as brightly as surface will-o’-wisps because even the dimmest light attracts notice underground. Long-lived and hateful creatures, they remember vivid details about their lives, travels, and most delicious prey. Although dread wisps could share extensive lore and unique experiences, they don’t, as they find amusement in others’ ignorance.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item Enervating Arc]] attacks.

Enervating Arc.name: Enervating Arc
Enervating Arc.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] scores a Critical Hit, the target also gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false].

Exhaustion.name: Exhaustion
Exhaustion.description: If the wisp scores a Critical Hit, the target also gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false].

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] and their light have the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition until the wisp’s &Reference[Concentration] ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes an attack roll or uses Consume Despair.

Shadow Flitter.name: Shadow Flitter
Shadow Flitter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports to a space they can see within 30 feet that is in Dim Light or Darkness.

Consume Despair.name: Consume Despair
Consume Despair.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=1sXZOs9UlLvdJ9v4]], one creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=1sXZOs9UlLvdJ9v4]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] that has at least 1 level of Exhaustion.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

save.condition: If one creature is within 5 feet of the wisp that has at least 1 level of Exhaustion

Unnerving Flickering.name: Unnerving Flickering
Unnerving Flickering.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional number of feet equal to the radius.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can alter the radius as an action.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=gQwDnmLGysVDOmOY]], any creature that ends its turn in the Bright Light.

Failure: The creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: The creature is immune to Unnerving Flickering for 24 hours.

Foundry Note

By default, the token light radius is set at 5-feet bright light and 10-feet dim light.

save.condition: Any creature that ends its turn in the Bright Light.

affects.special: Any creature that ends its turn in the Bright Light

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Ephemeral.name: Ephemeral
Ephemeral.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t wear or carry anything.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Drow Scout.name: Drow Scout
Drow Scout.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongbow000]{Longbow}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepShortsword]{Shortsword}

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .jdOlqVzYs89JuqTB]] and [[/item .qhM3PIWgXdyRCeul]] in any combination.

Drow Shootist.name: Drow Shootist
Drow Shootist.description: Drow who specialize in the repeating hand crossbow command respect for their skill and swagger.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The drow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .gNq2FqZR833L6SSb]]{Dancing Lights}

1/Day Each: [[/item .N8tAWRPJlYTihGL4]]{Darkness} , [[/item .JoCy1MX8fvBqV0y2]]{Faerie Fire}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow attacks twice with their [[/item Elven Curve Blade]] or twice with their [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]].

Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow
Repeating Hand Crossbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains Poisoned. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains &Reference[Poisoned apply=false].

Shootist’s Bandolier.name: Shootist’s Bandolier
Shootist’s Bandolier.description: The drow reloads their repeating hand crossbow.

Indomitable.name: Indomitable
Indomitable.description: If the drow fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Saves +5.name: Saves +5
Saves +5.description: If the drow fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The drow deals an extra 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the drow that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and the drow doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Reload Trick.name: Reload Trick
Reload Trick.description: If the drow’s [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]] is empty, they reload it and make one attack with it. If the target hasn’t seen the drow use Reload Trick before, the drow makes the attack with Advantage.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting

The caligni casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFogCloud00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGuidance00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMending000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplResistance], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSparetheDy]

Death Flare.name: Death Flare
Death Flare.description:
The caligni explodes into brilliant motes of magical energy when it dies.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Emanation originating from the caligni.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: Anything the caligni is wearing or carrying falls to the ground unharmed.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The caligni deals an extra 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the caligni that doesn’t have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and the caligni doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Fog Cloud.name: Fog Cloud
Fog Cloud.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The Sphere is &Reference[heavilyobscured]. It lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as one created by @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind}) disperses it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The fog's radius increases by 20 feet for each spell slot level above 1.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

Resistance.name: Resistance
Resistance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a damage type: Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing, Poison, Radiant, Slashing, or Thunder. When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by 1d4. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Acid Protection.name: Acid Protection
Acid Protection.description: When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by [[/r 1d4]]. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Spare the Dying.name: Spare the Dying
Spare the Dying.description:
Choose a creature within range that has 0 Hit Points and isn't dead. The creature becomes Stable.

Cantrip Upgrade. The range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

Aid.name: Aid
Aid.description:
Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's Hit Point maximum and current Hit Points increase by 5 for the duration.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Each target's Hit Points increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 2.

Level 2: +5 Max HP.name: Level 2: +5 Max HP
Level 2: +5 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 3: +10 Max HP.name: Level 3: +10 Max HP
Level 3: +10 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 4: +15 Max HP.name: Level 4: +15 Max HP
Level 4: +15 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 5: +20 Max HP.name: Level 5: +20 Max HP
Level 5: +20 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 6: +25 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 7: +30 Max HP.name: Level 7: +30 Max HP
Level 7: +30 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 8: +35 Max HP.name: Level 8: +35 Max HP
Level 8: +35 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Level 9: +40 Max HP.name: Level 9: +40 Max HP
Level 9: +40 Max HP.description: The target's Hit Point maximum is increased for the duration.

Banishment.name: Banishment
Banishment.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration. While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn't return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM's choice) associated with its creature type.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 4.

Banished.name: Banished
Banished.description:
While there, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

If the target is an Aberration, a Celestial, an Elemental, a Fey, or a Fiend, the target doesn’t return if the spell lasts for 1 minute. The target is instead transported to a random location on a plane (DM’s choice) associated with its creature type.

Create Food and Water.name: Create Food and Water
Create Food and Water.description: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of fresh water on the ground or in containers within range—both useful in fending off the hazards of malnutrition and dehydration. The food is bland but nourishing and looks like a food of your choice, and the water is clean. The food spoils after 24 hours if uneaten.

Create or Destroy Water.name: Create or Destroy Water
Create or Destroy Water.description:
You do one of the following:

Create Water. You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot Cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames there.

Destroy Water. You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot Cube within range.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the Cube increases by 5 feet, for each spell slot level above 1.

materials.value: a mix of water and sand

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Death Ward.name: Death Ward
Death Ward.description:
You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Protection from Death.name: Protection from Death
Protection from Death.description:
The first time the target would drop to 0 Hit Points before the spell ends, the target instead drops to 1 Hit Point, and the spell ends.

If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

Detect Evil and Good.name: Detect Evil and Good
Detect Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, you sense the location of any Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of yourself. You also sense whether the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHallow0000]{Hallow} spell is active there and, if so, where.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
You hurl a bolt of light toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 4d6 Radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against it before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 1.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has Advantage.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Flame Strike.name: Flame Strike
Flame Strike.description:
A vertical column of brilliant fire roars down from above. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d6 Fire damage and 5d6 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Fire damage and the Radiant damage increase by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 5.

Heroes' Feast.name: Heroes' Feast
Heroes' Feast.description:
You conjure a feast that appears on a surface in an unoccupied 10-foot Cube next to you. The feast takes 1 hour to consume and disappears at the end of that time, and the beneficial effects don't set in until this hour is over. Up to twelve creatures can partake of the feast.

A creature that partakes gains several benefits, which last for 24 hours. The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

materials.value: a gem-encrusted bowl worth 1,000+ GP, which the spell consumes

Consume Feast.name: Consume Feast
Consume Feast.chatFlavor: Hit Point maximum increased by healing amount

Feast's Benefits.name: Feast's Benefits
Feast's Benefits.description: The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

Insect Plague.name: Insect Plague
Insect Plague.description:
Swarming locusts fill a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The Sphere remains for the duration, and its area is &Reference[LightlyObscured] and &Reference[DifficultTerrain].

When the swarm appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 5.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the caligni has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Wand of Lightning Bolts.name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
Wand of Lightning Bolts.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 3 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Lightning Bolt.name: Lightning Bolt
Lightning Bolt.description:
A stroke of lightning forming a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the Line makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a bit of fur and a crystal rod

Feast's Benefits.name: Feast's Benefits
Feast's Benefits.description: The creature has &Reference[damageResistance]{Resistance} to Poison damage, and it has Immunity to the &Reference[Frightened] and &Reference[Poisoned] conditions. Its Hit Point maximum also increases by 2d10, and it gains the same number of Hit Points.

Gogiteth.name: Gogiteth
Gogiteth.description:
A gogiteth is a slavering nightmare of teeth, eyes, and hairy spiderlike legs, and its appearance is invariably seared into the minds of any who witness it. Hives of these skittering monsters haunt the lowest reaches of the Darklands, competing with cave worms and other subterranean horrors for food and resources. A gogiteth is rarely alone, as they learned that the best means of survival is sticking with others of their own kind. Even the hardiest Darklands residents seek cover when a gogiteth is spotted, for where there’s one, a swarm is sure to follow.

Gogiteths make a clacking sound as they skitter. The joints in their many legs pop and crack with each movement, though they can suppress this voluntarily and hunt silently without alerting prey. They can also make a high-pitched whistling sound that echoes throughout the caverns where they live. Some Darklands natives report that groups of gogiteths sometimes join together in eerie, discordant songs.

Carry Off Prey.name: Carry Off Prey
Carry Off Prey.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

Relentless Hunter.name: Relentless Hunter
Relentless Hunter.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] and two with their [[/item Leg]]{Legs}.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 18).

Until this grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and takes [[/damage average activity=iY1h16QeaXfft56r]] damage at the start of each of its turns, and the gogiteth can’t Bite another target.

damage.condition: If the target is grappled and restrained by the attacking creature

affects.special: Grappled and restrained by the attacking creature

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition. Until this grapple ends, the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false]

Skittering Assault.name: Skittering Assault
Skittering Assault.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up twice their Speed.

During this movement, each time the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves within 10 feet of a creature, they can make a [[/item Leg]] attack against that creature. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can’t attack the same creature more than once in this way.

Skittering Reposition.name: Skittering Reposition
Skittering Reposition.description:
Trigger: A creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see moves into a space within [[lookup @range.value activity=PTub0WYV343y3wnE]] feet of them.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half their Speed without provoking &Reference[Opportunity Attacks].

utility.condition: A creature the gogiteth can see moves into a space within 10 feet of them

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Khurfel makes three attacks: one with his Bite, one with his Dagger, and one with his Wounding Rhoka Sword.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature that isn’t an Undead or Construct, it is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The target’s Hit Point maximum is reduced by 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Hit Points, and Khurfel regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
Heavy Crossbow.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 100/400 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Emerald Fulcrum Lens.name: Emerald Fulcrum Lens
Emerald Fulcrum Lens.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This concave green lens is pitted and flawed. Its edges are jagged and cut those who don’t handle the lens with care. While you are attuned to the Emerald Fulcrum Lens, your flesh is waxen and pallid, and spells and magical abilities that restore a creature’s Hit Points have no effect on you. (For example, the Cure Wounds spell doesn’t cause you to regain Hit Points, although you can regain Hit Points when you rest normally.) In return, you gain the following benefits:

  • You have Resistance to Necrotic damage.

  • Whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain Hit Points, you regain an additional 4 Hit Points.

  • If damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points, you can make a Constitution saving throw (DC 5 plus the damage taken), unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a success, you drop to 1 hit point instead.

Grim Resistance. You can use a Magic action to grasp the lens tightly with one hand and draw out Nhimbaloth’s magic. You regain 8d4 + 8 Hit Points, and you have Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects until the end of your next turn. Once you have used this property of the lens, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Infuse Nhimbaloth’s Tenacity. As a Magic action, you can present the lens in your hand and make a melee attack with a +7 attack bonus against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, you force the splinter of Nhimbaloth’s essence from the lens to possess the target. You lose Attunement to the lens, and the target becomes attuned to the lens instead, except the target can’t use the lens’s Grim Resistance or Infuse Nhimbaloth’s Tenacity properties. The target can’t end Attunement to the lens, but it can be ended by any effect that removes a possession effect, such as the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} spell. Since this is a form of possession, the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbEvilAndGoodPr]{Protection from Evil and Good} spell protects the target and causes Nhimbaloth’s essence to remain in the lens. The lens doesn’t have any magical properties until the possession ends; when it does, the essence returns to the lens.

save.condition: Damage reduces you to 0 Hit Points

Grim Saves.name: Grim Saves
Grim Saves.description: You have Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When Khurfel dies, his flesh sublimates into a noxious gas.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from Khurfel.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Wounding Rhoka Sword.name: Wounding Rhoka Sword
Wounding Rhoka Sword.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Hit Points lost to this weapon’s damage can be regained only through a Short or Long Rest, rather than by regeneration, magic, or any other means. Once per turn, Khurfel can wound a creature he hits with this weapon. A creature can suffer from multiple wounds from the weapon at once. While wounded, the creature takes [[/damage 1d4 average necrotic]] damage at the start of each of its turns for each wound it has.

At the end of each of its turns, the target makes a [[/save 15 con]] saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively, the wounded creature or a creature within 5 feet of it can use an action to make a [[/skill 15 med]] check, ending the effect of all wounds on a success.

Innate Spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
Innate Spellcasting.description:
Khurfel casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFeatherFal]{Feather Fall} (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAugury0000]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBlindnessD]{Blindness/Deafness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDivination]{Divination}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHarm000000]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplRayofEnfee]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

Feather Fall.name: Feather Fall
Feather Fall.description: Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends. If a creature lands before the spell ends, the creature takes no damage from the fall, and the spell ends for that creature.

activation.condition: when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you falls

materials.value: a small feather or piece of down

Augury.name: Augury
Augury.description:
You receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses the omen from the Omens table.

OmenFor Results That Will Be …
WealGood
WoeBad
Weal and woeGood and bad
IndifferenceNeither good nor bad

The spell doesn't account for circumstances, such as other spells, that might change the results.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

Blindness/Deafness.name: Blindness/Deafness
Blindness/Deafness.description:
One creature that you can see within range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] or &Reference[Deafened apply=false] condition (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Deafness.name: Deafness
Deafness.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Divination.name: Divination
Divination.description:
This spell puts you in contact with a god or a god's servants. You ask one question about a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply, which might be a short phrase or cryptic rhyme. The spell doesn't account for circumstances that might change the answer, such as the casting of other spells.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer.

materials.value: incense worth 25+ GP, which the spell consumes

Harm.name: Harm
Harm.description: You unleash virulent magic on a creature you can see within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 14d6 Necrotic damage, and its Hit Point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage it took. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. This spell can't reduce a target's Hit Point maximum below 1.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
A beam of enervating energy shoots from you toward a creature within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

On a failed save, the target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Brief Enfeeblement.name: Brief Enfeeblement
Brief Enfeeblement.description: The target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the start of your next turn.

Enervated.name: Enervated
Enervated.description: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests for the duration. During that time, it also subtracts 1d8 from all its damage rolls. The target repeats the [[/save ability=con]] save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

Vengeful Strike.name: Vengeful Strike
Vengeful Strike.description:
Trigger: A creature Khurfel can see within 5 feet hits him with an attack while he is holding a melee weapon.

Response: Khurfel makes a melee attack against the creature.

Cavern Distortion.name: Cavern Distortion
Cavern Distortion.description: The drow raises a hand and magically causes pebbles and dust to rise from the ground to surround the drow and each creature they choose within 60 feet of them. Attacks against an affected creature are made with Disadvantage. The effect lasts for 1 minute or until the drow’s &Reference[Concentration] on the effect ends.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: The drow has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition. Magic can’t put them to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the drow has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Underground Stride.name: Underground Stride
Underground Stride.description: While the drow is underground, Difficult Terrain caused by rubble or uneven ground doesn’t cost them extra movement.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a skill. Until the spell ends, the creature adds 1d4 to any ability check using the chosen skill.

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

Resistance.name: Resistance
Resistance.description: You touch a willing creature and choose a damage type: Acid, Bludgeoning, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing, Poison, Radiant, Slashing, or Thunder. When the creature takes damage of the chosen type before the spell ends, the creature reduces the total damage taken by 1d4. A creature can benefit from this spell only once per turn.

Spare the Dying.name: Spare the Dying
Spare the Dying.description:
Choose a creature within range that has 0 Hit Points and isn't dead. The creature becomes Stable.

Cantrip Upgrade. The range doubles when you reach levels 5 (30 feet), 11 (60 feet), and 17 (120 feet).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Booming Voice.name: Booming Voice
Booming Voice.description: Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Aid.name: Aid

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. Each target's Hit Points increase by 5 for each spell slot level above 2.
