Success: Half damage.

Yrorix.name: Yrorix
Yrorix.description: Drow who specialize in the repeating hand crossbow command respect for their skill and swagger.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: [[/item .0Flhp5WC84BDwCBo]]{Dancing Lights}

1/Day Each: [[/item .RNyIQW2bauqp0jqH]]{Darkness}, [[/item .Of7jGirngEkt6NyO]]{Faerie Fire}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name]] attacks twice with their [[/item Elven Curve Blade]] or twice with their [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]].

Repeating Hand Crossbow.name: Repeating Hand Crossbow
Repeating Hand Crossbow.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC 14.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains Poisoned. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Unconscious.name: Unconscious
Unconscious.description: If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while it remains &Reference[Poisoned apply=false].

Indomitable.name: Indomitable
Indomitable.description: If [[lookup @name]] fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Saves +5.name: Saves +5
Saves +5.description: If the drow fails a saving throw, they can reroll it with a +5 bonus.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Spider's Sting.name: Spider's Sting
Spider's Sting.description:
Injury Poison

A creature subjected to Lolth's Sting must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have the &reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, the creature also has the &Reference[Unconscious apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Reload Trick.name: Reload Trick
Reload Trick.description: If [[lookup @name]]’s [[/item Repeating Hand Crossbow]] is empty, they reload it and make one attack with it. If the target hasn’t seen [[lookup @name]] use Reload Trick before, [[lookup @name]] makes the attack with Advantage.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: [[lookup @name]] deals an extra 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) damage when they hit a target with an attack and have Advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of [[lookup @name]] that doesn’t have the Incapacitated condition and [[lookup @name]] doesn’t have Disadvantage on the attack roll.

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: [[lookup @name]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Belcorra Haruvex.name: Belcorra Haruvex
Belcorra Haruvex.description: If Belcorra is within the lowest chambers of Gauntlight (areas H37, I28, and J20), she can harness the ambient magic there to create the following effects. On Initiative count 20 (losing Initiative ties), Belcorra can create one effect or forego creating any effect that round. She can’t do so while she has the Incapacitated condition or is otherwise unable to take actions. If surprised, she can’t create an effect until after her first turn in combat. When encountered within her lair, Belcorra’s Challenge Rating increases to 17 (XP 18,000).

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: [[lookup @name]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane while on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: Belcorra can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. She takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

Legendary Resistance.name: Legendary Resistance
Legendary Resistance.description: If Belcorra fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. If she does, she can’t use Etherealness, and her Incorporeal Movement trait doesn’t function until the end of her next turn.

Site-Bound.name: Site-Bound
Site-Bound.description: Belcorra can’t leave the lowest three levels of the Abomination Vaults. When she is destroyed, she re-forms in [[/r 2d4]] days within area J20 (though she can reduce this time by using the Ebon Fulcrum Lens (page 218). Belcorra can be permanently destroyed only if she enacts her full revenge on Absalom or if Nhimbaloth devours her soul.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Belcorra makes two [[/item .GKKt2l4lE7kjVmGW]] attacks and uses [[/item .FV8izhYHFUzlk5Zr]].

Corrupting Gaze.name: Corrupting Gaze
Corrupting Gaze.description:
Belcorra glares at a creature she can see within 30 feet of her.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=rKG9KJuKx6eNjZLe]].

Failure: 28 (8d6) Psychic damage.

Success: Half damage.

Etherealness.name: Etherealness
Etherealness.description: Belcorra enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. She is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but she can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Gaze.name: Gaze
Gaze.description: Belcorra uses [[/item .FV8izhYHFUzlk5Zr]]. Belcorra can’t take this action again until the start of her next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Belcorra casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]], +10 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDancingLig], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireBolt00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMending000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMessage000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTrueStrike]

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplComprehend], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConfusion0], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldMonste], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHypnoticPa], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPhantasmal], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSeeInvisib], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTeleportat]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFingerofDe], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WmQpxfjZwF3MGUby]

Cantrip.name: Cantrip
Cantrip.description: Belcorra uses [[/item .0iEWHQS22OJiiUfF]] to cast an at-will spell.

Ghostly Stride.name: Ghostly Stride
Ghostly Stride.description: Belcorra flies up to half her Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Finger of Death.name: Finger of Death
Finger of Death.description:
You unleash negative energy toward a creature you can see within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 7d8 + 30 Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

A Humanoid killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmZombie00000000]{Zombie} (see appendix B) that follows your verbal orders.

Globe of Invulnerability.name: Globe of Invulnerability
Globe of Invulnerability.description:
An immobile, shimmering barrier appears in a 10-foot Emanation around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of level 5 or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect anything within it. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from areas of effect created by such spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The barrier blocks spells of 1 level higher for each spell slot level above 6.

Spell levels blocked:[[@item.level - 1]] and lower

Teleportation Circle.name: Teleportation Circle
Teleportation Circle.description:
As you cast the spell, you draw a 5-foot-radius circle on the ground inscribed with sigils that link your location to a permanent teleportation circle of your choice whose sigil sequence you know and that is on the same plane of existence as you. A shimmering portal opens within the circle you drew and remains open until the end of your next turn. Any creature that enters the portal instantly appears within 5 feet of the destination circle or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

Many major temples, guildhalls, and other important places have permanent teleportation circles. Each circle includes a unique sigil sequence—a string of runes arranged in a particular pattern.

When you first gain the ability to cast this spell, you learn the sigil sequences for two destinations on the Material Plane, determined by the DM. You might learn additional sigil sequences during your adventures. You can commit a new sigil sequence to memory after studying it for 1 minute.

You can create a permanent teleportation circle by casting this spell in the same location every day for 365 days.

materials.value: rare inks worth 50+ GP, which the spell consumes

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

See Invisibility.name: See Invisibility
See Invisibility.description: For the duration, you see creatures and objects that have the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Creatures and objects there appear ghostly.

Phantasmal Killer.name: Phantasmal Killer
Phantasmal Killer.description:
You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see within range and create an illusion of its deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 4d10 Psychic damage and has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the spell ends.

For the duration, the target makes a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes the Psychic damage again. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 4.

Fears Manifested.name: Fears Manifested
Fears Manifested.description:
The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls for the duration.

For the duration, the target makes a [[/save ability=wis]] saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes the Psychic damage again. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed, the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Hypnotized.name: Hypnotized
Hypnotized.description:
While &Reference[charmed apply=false], the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Hold Monster.name: Hold Monster
Hold Monster.description:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Paralyzed condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 5.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Confusion.name: Confusion
Confusion.description:
Each creature in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point you choose within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or that target can't take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The Sphere's radius increases by 5 feet for each spell slot level above 4.

Confused.name: Confused
Confused.description:
The target can’t take Bonus Actions or Reactions and must roll 1d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn, consulting the table below.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.phbsplConfusionB rollable cite=false classes="caption-top"]{Behavior for the Turn}

At the end of each of its turns, an affected target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Comprehend Languages.name: Comprehend Languages
Comprehend Languages.description: For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any language that you hear or see signed. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text. This spell doesn't decode symbols or secret messages.

materials.value: a pinch of soot and salt

True Strike.name: True Strike
True Strike.description:
Guided by a flash of magical insight, you make one attack with the weapon used in the spell's casting. The attack uses your spellcasting ability for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If the attack deals damage, it can be Radiant damage or the weapon's normal damage type (your choice).

Cantrip Upgrade. Whether you deal Radiant damage or the weapon's normal damage type, the attack deals extra Radiant damage when you reach levels 5 (1d6), 11 (2d6), and 17 (3d6).

materials.value: a weapon with which you have proficiency and that is worth 1+ CP

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Message.name: Message
Message.description:
You point toward a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear.

You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target and know it is beyond the barrier. Magical silence; 1 foot of stone, metal, or wood; or a thin sheet of lead blocks the spell.

Mending.name: Mending
Mending.description:
This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but it can't restore magic to such an object.

Fire Bolt.name: Fire Bolt
Fire Bolt.description:
You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or an object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell starts burning if it isn't being worn or carried.

Cantrip Upgrade. The damage increases by 1d10 when you reach levels 5 (2d10), 11 (3d10), and 17 (4d10).

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Gauntlight's Glare.name: Gauntlight's Glare
Gauntlight's Glare.description: Belcorra causes the ribbon of energy at the center of areas H37, I28, and J20 to flare, filling those areas with Bright Light until Initiative count 20 of the next round. If an area of Darkness created by a spell of level 7 or lower overlaps with these areas, that spell is dispelled. Belcorra can see along the ribbon’s length as if she were standing in all three areas simultaneously. In addition, she is aware of the presence of any magic within 30 feet of the ribbon and has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks she makes in those areas. Finally, an Undead creature (including Belcorra) that ends its turn in the intensified ribbon of energy regains 10 (3d6) Hit Points.

affects.special: The ribbon of energy at the center of areas H37, I28, and J20

Grasp of the Undying.name: Grasp of the Undying
Grasp of the Undying.description: Wispy hands emerge from the floor and ceiling until Initiative count 20 of the next round. The hands fill a 10-foot-square area Belcorra can see within 60 feet of her. While the hands last, the area is Difficult Terrain. When Belcorra uses her [[/item .GKKt2l4lE7kjVmGW]] attack, she can target any creature standing on the affected area.

Memento Mori.name: Memento Mori
Memento Mori.description: Grotesque faces resembling every creature Belcorra has ever killed (including those who were brought back from the dead) appear on every wall Belcorra can see within 60 feet of her. The faces last until Initiative count 20 of the next round. While the faces last, Belcorra can use [[/item .FV8izhYHFUzlk5Zr]] to target any creature within 30 feet of any haunted wall.

affects.special: Every wall that Belcorra can see

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Blowgun.name: Blowgun
Blowgun.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The dhuthorex casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBestowCurs] (level 5 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHypnoticPa]

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 16).

Aquatic Ambush.name: Aquatic Ambush
Aquatic Ambush.description: If the dhuthorex is underwater and hidden from a creature within 20 feet of them, the dhuthorex Swims up to 20 feet and makes a [[/item Bite]] attack against that creature. The dhuthorex has Advantage on the attack roll.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
The dhuthorex makes one [[/item Bite]] attack against a creature they are grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the Grapple ends. While swallowed, the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, and it has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the dhuthorex. In addition, the target takes 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) Acid damage at the end of each of the dhuthorex’s turns. The dhuthorex can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the dhuthorex takes 24 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the dhuthorex must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls &Reference[Prone apply=false] in a space within 10 feet of the dhuthorex. If the dhuthorex dies, a swallowed creature no longer has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and can escape from the corpse by using 10 feet of movement, exiting &Reference[Prone apply=false].

save.condition: takes 24 damage

Wavesense.name: Wavesense
Wavesense.description: The dhuthorex can’t use their Tremorsense outside of water.

Bestow Curse.name: Bestow Curse
Bestow Curse.description:
You touch a creature, which must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration. Until the curse ends, the target suffers one of the following effects of your choice:

  • Choose one ability. The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability (Curse Ability activity).
  • The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you (Curse Attacks activity).
  • In combat, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns or be forced to take the &Reference[Dodge] action on that turn (Curse Actions activity).
  • If you deal damage to the target with an attack roll or a spell, the target takes an extra 1d8 Necrotic damage (Curse Resilience activity).

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. If you cast this spell using a level 4 spell slot, you can maintain Concentration on it for up to 10 minutes. If you use a level 5+ spell slot, the spell doesn't require Concentration, and the duration becomes 8 hours (level 5–6 slot) or 24 hours (level 7–8 slot). If you use a level 9 spell slot, the spell lasts until dispelled.

Cursed Charisma.name: Cursed Charisma
Cursed Charisma.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Constitution.name: Cursed Constitution
Cursed Constitution.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Dexterity.name: Cursed Dexterity
Cursed Dexterity.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Intelligence.name: Cursed Intelligence
Cursed Intelligence.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Strength.name: Cursed Strength
Cursed Strength.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Wisdom.name: Cursed Wisdom
Cursed Wisdom.description: The target has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability.

Cursed Attacks.name: Cursed Attacks
Cursed Attacks.description: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Cursed Actions.name: Cursed Actions
Cursed Actions.description: In combat, the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] at the start of each of its turns or be forced to take the &Reference[Dodge] action on that turn.

Cursed Resilience.name: Cursed Resilience
Cursed Resilience.description: If you deal damage to the target with an attack roll or a spell, the target takes an extra [[/damage 1d8 type=necrotic]] damage.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Hypnotic Pattern.name: Hypnotic Pattern
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors in a 30-foot Cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who can see the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition for the duration. While Charmed, the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Hypnotized.name: Hypnotized
Hypnotized.description:
While &Reference[charmed apply=false], the creature has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition and a Speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious
Amphibious.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can breathe air and water.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The dhuthorex uses [[/item Frightful Presence]] then makes two attacks: one with their [[/item Bite]] or [[/item Snout]] and one with their [[/item Tentacle]].

Snout.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect.

Strength Saving Throw: DC 16.

Failure: The dhuthorex pushes the target up to 10 feet or gives them the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition (dhuthorex’s choice).

Frightful Presence.name: Frightful Presence
Frightful Presence.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature of the dhuthorex’s choice in a 120-foot Emanation originating from the dhuthorex.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. At the end of each of its turns, the creature repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Success: The target is immune to this dhuthorex’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

Multiattack.description: The irlgaunt makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Stomp]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

Regurgitate Gastrolith.name: Regurgitate Gastrolith
Regurgitate Gastrolith.description:
The irlgaunt regurgitates a clot of stone and digestive enzymes.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the irlgaunt can see within 30 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]].

Success: Half damage.

Stone Step.name: Stone Step
Stone Step.description: Difficult Terrain caused by rocks or stone doesn’t cost the irlgaunt extra movement.

Meld into Stone.name: Meld into Stone
Meld into Stone.description:
You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, merging yourself and your equipment with the stone for the duration. You must touch the stone to do so. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.

While merged with the stone, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with Disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the stone. You can use 5 feet of movement to leave the stone where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.

Minor physical damage to the stone doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals [[/damage 6d6 type=force]] damage to you. The stone's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals [[/damage 50 type=force]] damage to you. If expelled, you move into an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered and have the &Reference[prone] condition.

Stone Shape.name: Stone Shape
Stone Shape.description: You touch a stone object of Medium size or smaller or a section of stone no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape you like. For example, you could shape a large rock into a weapon, statue, or coffer, or you could make a small passage through a wall that is 5 feet thick. You could also shape a stone door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

Fire Elemental.description:
Fire Elemental

Fire Aura.name: Fire Aura
Fire Aura.description: At the end of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]] of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=15VgJKVXwYBOFSqJ]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage. Creatures and flammable objects in the Emanation start burning.

Fire Form.name: Fire Form
Fire Form.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so, and it can enter a creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] sheds Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet.

Water Susceptibility.name: Water Susceptibility
Water Susceptibility.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 3 (1d6) Cold damage damage for every 5 feet the [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves in water or for every gallon of water splashed on it.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured to roll the correct number of dice based on the distance traveled through water. 1 is default for 5 feet, 2 is for 10 feet, and so forth.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBurn0000000000]] attacks.

Burn.name: Burn
Burn.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it starts &Reference[burning].

Ghostglass Golem.name: Ghostglass Golem
Ghostglass Golem.description: Some golem crafters build golems from magically empowered glass and treated lead, as these glass golems are exceptionally sharp. In the early days of Nhimbaloth's worship in hidden places on Golarion, some of her priests formed glass golems that could slice not only flesh, but souls. These "ghostglass" golems were deemed a remarkable improvement for their loyalty and durability.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The golem makes two [[/item Blade]] attacks.

Blade.name: Blade
Blade.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature other than a Construct or Undead, it suffers a bleeding wound. While suffering from a bleeding wound, the target loses [[/damage 1d8 average]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. A creature can suffer from multiple bleeding wounds. Any creature can take an action to stanch one wound with a successful [[/skill med 15]] check. All wounds close if the target regains any Hit Points.

Bleeding.name: Bleeding
Bleeding.description: The target suffers a bleeding wound. While suffering from a bleeding wound, the target loses [[/damage 1d8 average]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns.

Grim Glittering.name: Grim Glittering
Grim Glittering.description: The golem creates waves of baleful light that shed Dim Light in a 60-foot Emanation originating from the golem until the start of the golem’s next turn. While the light lasts, a creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its there is subjected to the following effect. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15. Failure: The target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the golem’s next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature also has Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws until it finishes a Short or Long Rest.

Blinded.name: Blinded
Blinded.description: The target has the Blinded condition until the end of the golem’s next turn.

Glittering Disadvantage.name: Glittering Disadvantage
Glittering Disadvantage.description: If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature also has Disadvantage on Death Saving Throws until it finishes a Short or Long Rest.

Reflect Spell.name: Reflect Spell
Reflect Spell.description:
Trigger: A creature the golem can see hits the golem with a spell attack.

Response: The golem attempts to reflect the spell back at that caster. The golem makes a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against a DC equal to the result of the triggering attack roll. On a success, the spell targets the caster instead of the golem, using the spell slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the caster.

Fire Absorption.name: Fire Absorption
Fire Absorption.description: Whenever the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is subjected to Fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Fire damage dealt.

Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.name: Slow
rHwlDG85kUcrUFdg.description:
You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot Cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration.

An affected target's Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs<=25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell's gestures too slowly.

An affected target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Foundry Note

The inline roll above will return 1 if it succeeded or 0 if it failed.

Slowed.name: Slowed
Slowed.description:
An affected target’s Speed is halved, it takes a −2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can’t take Reactions. On its turns, it can take either an action or a Bonus Action, not both, and it can make only one attack if it takes the Attack action. If it casts a spell with a Somatic component, there is a [[/r 1d100cs>25#Slowed spell cast success]]{25 percent} chance the spell fails as a result of the target making the spell’s gestures too slowly.

Pincer.name: Pincer

Mind Feeding.name: Mind Feeding

Paralyzing Tentacles.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
Paralyzing Tentacles.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false] by the chuul.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While &Reference[Poisoned apply=false], the target has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: Difficult Terrain caused by swampy terrain doesn’t cost the chuul extra movement.

Amphibious.name: Amphibious

Sense Magic.name: Sense Magic

Skillful Catch.name: Skillful Catch

Response: Carman adds 2 to his AC. If the attack misses, Carman catches the weapon and immediately makes a ranged attack with it.

Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor} (included in AC), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageHand00]{Mage Hand}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (level 4 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplConeofCold]{Cone of Cold}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMistyStep0]{Misty Step}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.name: Misty Step
BtkwckQJktc8hRh0.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCounterspe]{Counterspell} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: when you see a creature within range casting a spell with Verbal, Somatic, or Material components

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

When you cast the spell, you can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial.

As a Magic action on your later turns, you can control the hand thus again. As part of that action, you can move the hand up to 30 feet.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
A bright streak flashes from you to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into a fiery explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried start burning.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 3.

materials.value: a ball of bat guano and sulfur

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description:
You unleash a blast of cold air. Each creature in a 60-foot Cone originating from you makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 Cold damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 5.

materials.value: a small crystal or glass cone

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Wrin casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectMagi], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEldritchBl], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCharmPerso], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplCureWounds], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDarkness00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDaylight00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEnthrall00], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFaerieFire], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHellishReb] (level 2 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplLesserRest], @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplRemoveCurs]

Claustrophobia.name: Claustrophobia
Claustrophobia.description:
While underground or in an indoor space smaller than 10 feet in diameter, Wrin makes ability checks and attack rolls with Disadvantage.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (off by default) which automates the Disadvantage on ability checks but not attack rolls.

Read The Stars.name: Read The Stars
Read The Stars.description:
By spending 1 hour studying the night sky, Wrin can attempt to read the future in the stars. Wrin can’t use this trait during the day, on an overcast night, or when she otherwise can’t study the stars. The topic of her reading must be a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity directly involving the inquiring creature that will occur within 24 hours.

Wrin attempts an Intelligence check using [[/tool navg ability=int]]{Navigator’s Tools} (DC 10 + the inquiring creature’s level or Challenge Rating). On a successful check, the GM offers a truthful reply in the form of a horoscope reading. The reply doesn’t take into account uncertain intervening circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of additional spells or the loss of a companion. If the check succeeds by 5 or more, the subjects of the reading each gain a +1 bonus to saving throws for 24 hours.

Star Reading Bonus.name: Star Reading Bonus
Star Reading Bonus.description: If the check succeeds by 5 or more, the subjects of the reading each gain a +1 bonus to saving throws for 24 hours.

Spirit Sight.name: Spirit Sight
Spirit Sight.description: Wrin can see creatures with the Incorporeal Movement trait within 30 feet, regardless of whether they’re visible to the naked eye. This ability sometimes allows Wrin to notice other supernatural auras, such as the buildup of spiritual energy atop Gauntlight.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell's range.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magical effects within 30 feet of yourself. If you sense such effects, you can take the Magic action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears the magic, and if an effect was created by a spell, you learn the spell's school of magic.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description:
You hurl a beam of crackling energy. Make a ranged spell attack against one creature or object in range. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 Force damage.

Cantrip Upgrade. The spell creates two beams at level 5, three beams at level 11, and four beams at level 17. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

[[(floor((@details.level+1)/6)+1)]]{Total Beams}

Minor Illusion.name: Minor Illusion
Minor Illusion.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. See the descriptions below for the effects of each. The illusion ends if you cast this spell again.

If a creature takes a Study action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Sound. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

Image. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot Cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, since things can pass through it.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with Advantage if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d8 for each spell slot level above 1.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 plus its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends early if the target dons armor.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
For the duration, magical &Reference[darkness] spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Daylight.name: Daylight
Daylight.description:
For the duration, sunlight spreads from a point within range and fills a 60-foot-radius Sphere. The sunlight's area is Bright Light and sheds Dim Light for an additional 60 feet.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn't being worn or carried, causing the sunlight to fill a 60-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the sunlight.

If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of Darkness created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

Enthrall.name: Enthrall
Enthrall.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, a target has a −10 penalty to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Distracted.name: Distracted
Distracted.description: The target has a −10 penalty to [[/check ability=wis skill=prc]] checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Objects in a 20-foot Cube within range are outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Each creature in the Cube is also outlined if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Outlined.name: Outlined
Outlined.description:
For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed &Reference[dimlight] in a 10-foot radius and can’t benefit from the Invisible condition.

Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have Advantage if the attacker can see it.

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description:
The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

activation.condition: taking damage from a creature that you can see within 60 feet of yourself

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Remove Curse.name: Remove Curse
Remove Curse.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's Attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

Starknife.name: Starknife
Starknife.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]].

From a central metal ring, four tapering metal blades extend like points on a compass rose. When gripping a starknife from the center, the wielder can use it as a melee weapon. It can also be thrown short distances.

Graveyard Skeleton.name: Graveyard Skeleton
Graveyard Skeleton.description:
Skeletons are reanimated Humanoid bones bearing the equipment they had in life. They have rudimentary faculties and greater agility than zombies and similar shambling corpses. While they aren’t capable of creating plans of their own, they avoid obvious barriers and self-destructive situations.

Skeletons

Skeletons rise at the summons of necromancers and foul spirits. Whether they’re the remains of the ancient dead or fresh bones bound to morbid ambitions, they commit deathless work for whatever forces reanimated them, often serving as guardians, soldiers, or laborers. In rare cases, skeletons are reanimated but given no particular direction. Roll on or choose a result from the Skeleton Pantomimes table to inspire how undirected skeletons behave.

Hellforged Bearded Devil.description:
Bearded Devil

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmBeard000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmInfernalGlaive]] attack.

Beard.name: Beard
Beard.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can't regain Hit Points.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the user's next turn. Until this poison ends, the target can’t regain Hit Points.

Infernal Glaive.name: Infernal Glaive
Infernal Glaive.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature and doesn't already have an infernal wound, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=4qy3fKL086OAE1xR]].

Failure: The target receives an infernal wound. While wounded, the target loses [[/damage average activity=IS4utGV80LpDrjvt]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a [[/check format=long activity=KNWa0TFhANjmQCds]].

Warped Brew Morlock Scavenger.name: Warped Brew Morlock Scavenger
Warped Brew Morlock Scavenger.description: Most morlocks have little talent for crafting, but a rare few have an uncanny knack for tinkering.

Swarming Stance.name: Swarming Stance
Swarming Stance.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can occupy the same space as another willing creature with this trait.

While they share a creature’s space in this way, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes melee attack rolls with Advantage.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Scuttling Attack.name: Scuttling Attack
Scuttling Attack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] moves up to half their Speed without provoking &Reference[Opportunity Attacks]. During this movement, &Reference[Difficult Terrain] doesn’t cost the [[lookup @name lowercase]] extra movement. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] then makes a melee attack.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Foundry Note

This feature includes an Active Effect (AE) to enable in the Effects tab that applies disadvantage on ability checks. However, there is currently no automation to apply disadvantage to attack rolls. This AE can serve as a reminder for that action.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: While in sunlight, Augrael has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Wooden Chair.name: Wooden Chair
Wooden Chair.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended]]. If the target is a creature, it makes a [[/save]] saving throw. On a failed save, the morlock either pushes the target 5 feet directly away from it or gives them the &Reference[Prone] condition (morlock’s choice).

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Child of Belcorra uses [[/item .r3ABIOFDCQlZtleL]] and makes one [[/item .ThwFDP8vT0PV3uo1]] attack.

Rotting Fist.name: Rotting Fist
Rotting Fist.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a creature, it is cursed.

While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse.

A creature dies and decays into a foul-smelling sludge if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Cursed.name: Cursed
Cursed.description: If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can’t regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn’t return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/r 3d6#HP Max Decrease]]{10 (3d6)} every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

Breathtaking Glare.name: Breathtaking Glare
Breathtaking Glare.description:
The Child of Belcorra targets one [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] they can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]] feet of them. If the target can see the Child, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=8LmlZfevSQkOxGSN]].

Failure: The target can’t breathe or speak. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Success: The target is immune to this Child of Belcorra’s Breathtaking Glare for the next 24 hours.

9q2zHwpczCAKxjUK.name: Breathtaking Glare
9q2zHwpczCAKxjUK.description: The creature can’t breathe or speak. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description:
&Reference[Difficult Terrain] caused by swampy terrain doesn’t cost the Child of Belcorra extra movement.

The Child of Belcorra has a +2 bonus to Stealth checks made in swamps.

Gnomish Cunning.name: Gnomish Cunning
Gnomish Cunning.description: The Child of Belcorra has Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

Ambusher.name: Ambusher
Ambusher.description: In the first round of a combat, the Child of Belcorra has Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that began the combat surprised.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] attacks and one [[/item .mmSnakeHair00000]] attack, or it makes three [[/item .mmPoisonRay00000]] attacks.

Petrifying Gaze.name: Petrifying Gaze
Petrifying Gaze.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]], each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]-foot [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]]. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] sees its reflection in the [[lookup @target.template.type capitalize activity=mN9aF1WkHQWLIN4B]], the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must make this save.

First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Second Failure: The target has the &Reference[Petrified apply=false] condition instead of the Restrained condition.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Petrified.name: Petrified
Petrified.description: The target has the &Reference[Petrified apply=false] condition instead of the Restrained condition.

Nyzuros.name: Nyzuros
Nyzuros.description: Hunters seek out game to keep drow communities fed and functioning.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The drow attacks once with their [[/item Longsword]] and once with their [[/item Dagger]]. Alternatively, they attack twice with their [[/item Longbow]].

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
[[lookup @name]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using [[lookup @attributes.spell.abilityLabel]] as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

1/Day Each: [[/item .SX2fBn6vgjDpdKCO]]{Darkness} , [[/item .a4h0gt5opOSZ23fw]]{Faerie Fire}

Fey Ancestry.name: Fey Ancestry
Fey Ancestry.description: [[lookup @name]] has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put it to sleep.

Sunlight Sensitivity.description:
While in sunlight, [[lookup @name]] has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.
