Burglar's Pack.description: A Burglar's Pack contains the following items: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBackpack000]{Backpack}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBallBearing]{Ball Bearings}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBell0000000]{Bell}, 10 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCandle00000]{Candles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCrowbar0000]{Crowbar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.wjHtGnd05SPdURqE]{Hooded Lantern}, 7 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagOil00000000]{flasks of Oil}, 5 days of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRations0000]{Rations}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRope0000000]{Rope}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagTinderbox00]{Tinderbox}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagWaterskin00]{Waterskin}.

Candle.name: Candle
Candle.description: For 1 hour, a lit Candle sheds Bright Light in a 5-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 5 feet.

Crawler Mucus.name: Crawler Mucus
Crawler Mucus.description:
Contact Poison

A creature subjected to Carrion Crawler Mucus must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute. The creature also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Crowbar.name: Crowbar
Crowbar.description: Using a Crowbar gives you Advantage on Strength checks where the Crowbar's leverage can be applied.

Hat of Disguise.name: Hat of Disguise
Hat of Disguise.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this hat, you can cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} spell. The spell ends if the hat is removed.

Healer's Kit.name: Healer's Kit
Healer's Kit.description: A Healer's Kit has ten uses. As a Utilize action, you can expend one of its uses to stabilize an Unconscious creature that has 0 Hit Points without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

Herbalism Kit.name: Herbalism Kit
Herbalism Kit.description:
Ability: Intelligence

Utilize: Identify a plant (DC 10)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAntitoxin00]{Antitoxin}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCandle00000]{Candle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHealersKit0]{Healer's Kit}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPotionofHea]{Potion of Healing}

Hooded Lantern.name: Hooded Lantern
Hooded Lantern.description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

Mithral Diadem.name: Mithral Diadem
Mithral Diadem.description: This mithral diadem depicts a mossy skull with emerald eyes.

Necrotic Bomb (Basic).name: Necrotic Bomb (Basic)
Necrotic Bomb (Basic).description:
Combining the worst parts of a rotting corpse with reagents most people consider unholy, Necrotic Bombs create a miasma of life-sucking substance when exposed to the air.

When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a Necrotic Bomb. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus).

On a failure, the target takes [[/damage activity=RZefsvLGcUqAkeH6]] damage. Even on a successful save, the target takes [[/damage activity=kMHoXS53nXjPkjbS]] damage. In addition, each creature within 5 feet of the target takes damage as if it had successfully saved against the bomb. Constructs take no damage from a Necrotic Bomb.

Oil.name: Oil
Oil.description:
You can douse a creature, object, or space with Oil or use it as fuel, as detailed below.

Dousing a Creature or an Object. When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing an Oil flask. Target one creature or object within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or be covered in oil. If the target takes Fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an extra [[/damage 5 type=fire]] damage from burning oil.

Dousing a Space. You can take the Utilize action to pour an Oil flask on level ground to cover a 5-foot-square area within 5 feet of yourself. If lit, the oil burns until the end of the turn 2 rounds from when the oil was lit (or 12 seconds) and deals 5 Fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn there. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

Fuel. Oil serves as fuel for Lamps and Lanterns. Once lit, a flask of Oil burns for 6 hours in a Lamp or Lantern. That duration doesn't need to be consecutive; you can extinguish the burning Oil (as a Utilize action) and rekindle it again until it has burned for a total of 6 hours.

Potion of Giant Strength (Stone).name: Potion of Giant Strength (Stone)
Potion of Giant Strength (Stone).description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, your Strength score changes for 1 hour to 23. The type of giant determines the score. The potion has no effect on you if your Strength is equal to or greater than that score.

This potion's transparent liquid has floating in it a sliver of light resembling a giant's fingernail.

Potion of Greater Healing.name: Potion of Greater Healing
Potion of Greater Healing.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 4d4+4 hit points when you drink this potion.

Rations.name: Rations
Rations.description: Rations consist of travel-ready food, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts. See &Reference[Malnutrition] in the rules glossary for the risks of not eating.

Rope.name: Rope
Rope.description:
As a Utilize action, you can tie a knot with Rope if you succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check. The Rope can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check.

You can bind an unwilling creature with the Rope only if the creature has the &Reference[Grappled], &Reference[Incapacitated], or &Reference[Restrained] condition. If the creature's legs are bound, the creature has the Restrained condition until it escapes. Escaping the Rope requires the creature to make a successful DC 15 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check as an action.

Siora's Poison Codex.name: Siora's Poison Codex
Siora's Poison Codex.description: This book contains instructions to create the following poisons: Assassin’s Blood, Burnt Othur Fumes, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.6F1A20MB89RVLyp0]{Stupor Poison}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgTruthSerum000]{Truth Serum}.

Spell Scroll: Detect Thoughts.name: Spell Scroll: Detect Thoughts
Spell Scroll: Detect Thoughts.description:
2nd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll], Requires Concentration

You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Tinderbox.name: Tinderbox
Tinderbox.description: A Tinderbox is a small container holding flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a Candle, Lamp, Lantern, or Torch—or anything else with exposed fuel—takes a Bonus Action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Water (Pint).name: Water (Pint)
Water (Pint).description: If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk &Reference[dehydration].

Waterskin.name: Waterskin
Waterskin.description: A Waterskin holds up to 4 pints. If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk &Reference[dehydration].

Congealed Potion of Superior Healing.name: Congealed Potion of Superior Healing
Congealed Potion of Superior Healing.description:
This forgotten Potion of Superior Healing has partially congealed over time. A character can drink this potion using a Bonus Action to shake it loose before spending an action to drink it.

The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 8d4+8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Theorbo.name: Theorbo
Theorbo.description:
Ability: Charisma

Utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

Chain.name: Chain
Chain.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two chains, and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC) from one of two chains, and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Fishing Tackle.name: Fishing Tackle
Fishing Tackle.description: This kit includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

Hellforged Dagger.name: Hellforged Dagger
Hellforged Dagger.description: Weapons forged in the depths of Hell often gain sinister powers. In the hands of a devil, Hellforged Weapons deal an additional [[/r 1d6]] Necrotic damage. Although worth as much as an ordinary weapon of its kind, Hellforged Weapons exude palpable menace, and upstanding merchants usually refuse to trade in them.

Hellforged Glaive.name: Hellforged Glaive
Hellforged Glaive.description: Weapons forged in the depths of Hell often gain sinister powers. In the hands of a devil, Hellforged Weapons deal an additional [[/r 1d6]] Necrotic damage. Although worth as much as an ordinary weapon of its kind, Hellforged Weapons exude palpable menace, and upstanding merchants usually refuse to trade in them.

Pale Tincture.name: Pale Tincture
Pale Tincture.description:
Ingested Poison

A creature subjected to Pale Tincture must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) Poison damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. The Poisoned creature repeats the save every 24 hours, taking 3 (1d6) Poison damage on a failed save. The damage the poison deals can't be healed by any means while the creature remains Poisoned. After seven successful saves against the poison, the creature is no longer Poisoned.

Foundry Note

The Use Poison activity includes the save and the Poisoned and Reduce Max Active Effect applies the Poisoned condition and can be used for preventing healing as well. Edit the Active Effect on the player, change to the "Effects" tab and adjust the "Effect Value" to be "-X" where X is the total damage they've taken from the poison. This will temporarily reduce their max HP by that value.

Poisoned and Reduce Max.name: Poisoned and Reduce Max
Poisoned and Reduce Max.description: The Poisoned creature repeats the save every 24 hours, taking 3 (1d6) Poison damage on a failed save. The damage the poison deals can't be healed by any means while the creature remains Poisoned. After seven successful saves against the poison, the creature is no longer Poisoned.

Piton.name: Piton
Piton.description: A metal spike that is drive into a seam in a climbing surface with a climbing hammer. It can also be used like iron spikes to block doors in a pinch.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: You gain the Armor Class benefit of a Shield only if you have training with it.

Spell Scroll: Spirit Guardians.name: Spell Scroll: Spirit Guardians
Spell Scroll: Spirit Guardians.description:
3rd Level &Reference[Spell Scroll], Requires Concentration

Protective spirits flit around you in a 15-foot Emanation for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it. Any other creature's Speed is halved in the Emanation, and whenever the Emanation enters a creature's space and whenever a creature enters the Emanation or ends its turn there, the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 Radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 Necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 3.

Half Speed.name: Half Speed
Half Speed.description: The creature's speed is halved while within the Emanation.

Spikes, Iron.name: Spikes, Iron
Spikes, Iron.description: Iron Spikes come in bundles of ten. As a Utilize action, you can use a blunt object, such as a Light Hammer, to hammer a spike into wood, earth, or a similar material. You can do so to jam a door shut or to then tie a Rope or Chain to the Spike.

Spyglass.name: Spyglass
Spyglass.description: Objects viewed through a Spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

Necrotic Bomb (Moderate).name: Necrotic Bomb (Moderate)
Necrotic Bomb (Moderate).description:
Combining the worst parts of a rotting corpse with reagents most people consider unholy, Necrotic Bombs create a miasma of life-sucking substance when exposed to the air.

When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a Necrotic Bomb. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus).

On a failure, the target takes [[/damage activity=7iRwP152I2knBax2]] damage. Even on a successful save, the target takes [[/damage activity=Ty3NjHCoOamzoNkl]] damage. In addition, each creature within 5 feet of the target takes damage as if it had successfully saved against the bomb. Constructs take no damage from a Necrotic Bomb.

Spell Scroll: Dream.name: Spell Scroll: Dream
Spell Scroll: Dream.description:
5th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You target a creature you know on the same plane of existence. You or a willing creature you touch enters a trance state to act as a dream messenger. While in the trance, the messenger is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] and has a Speed of 0.

If the target is asleep, the messenger appears in the target's dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains asleep, through the spell's duration. The messenger can also shape the dream's environment, creating landscapes, objects, and other images. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the spell. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking.

If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to sleep, at which point the messenger enters its dreams.

You can make the messenger terrifying to the target. If you do so, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words, and then the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains no benefit from its rest, and it takes 3d6 Psychic damage when it wakes up.

Trance State.name: Trance State
Trance State.description: While in the trance, the messenger is Incapacitated and has a Speed of 0.

Urevian's pendant.name: Urevian's pendant
Urevian's pendant.description:
Once all five pieces of Urevian's pendant are brought together, they function as an Amulet of Proof Against Detection and Location.

The five pendant pieces are in areas @UUID[JournalEntry.KI33EAGPVHP4zyFZ.JournalEntryPage.psfaf5Skhe3bMKsr]{F5}, @UUID[JournalEntry.OyNcqrpRClyhr8BJ.JournalEntryPage.JCRGIRMAhYyjkSvF]{G4}, @UUID[JournalEntry.OyNcqrpRClyhr8BJ.JournalEntryPage.AeQmFFVsCUF02tzd]{G5}, @UUID[JournalEntry.OyNcqrpRClyhr8BJ.JournalEntryPage.fK6B6GmATzvRIuh4]{G7}, and @UUID[JournalEntry.OyNcqrpRClyhr8BJ.JournalEntryPage.RiUE936phCZx8Hqe]{G18}.

Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this amulet, you can't be targeted by &Reference[schoolsofmagic]{Divination} spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors unless you allow it.

+2 Arrows.name: +2 Arrows
+2 Arrows.description:
Storage: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagQuiver00000]{Quiver}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAmmunitionV]{Ammunition} is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Alchemist's Fire.name: Alchemist's Fire
Alchemist's Fire.description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Alchemist's Fire. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take [[/damage 1d4 type=fire]] damage and start &Reference[burning].

Arrow.name: Arrow
Arrow.description: Standard ammunition used for bows of all varieties. These mundane arrows are made of smooth wooden shafts with goose feather fletching and hammer metal bodkins.

Bag of Holding.name: Bag of Holding
Bag of Holding.description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions—roughly 2 feet square and 4 feet deep on the inside. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 5 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires a Utilize action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. The bag holds enough air for 10 minutes of breathing, divided by the number of breathing creatures inside.

Placing a Bag of Holding inside an extradimensional space created by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgHewardsHandyH]{Handy Haversack}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgPortableHole0]{Portable Hole}, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way and can't be reopened.

Cloak of Protection.name: Cloak of Protection
Cloak of Protection.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

Elemental Gem (Blue Sapphire).name: Elemental Gem (Blue Sapphire)
Elemental Gem (Blue Sapphire).description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgElementalGem0]

This gem contains a mote of elemental energy. When you take a Utilize action to break the gem, an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmAirElemental00]{Air Elemental} is summoned, and the gem ceases to be magical. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the broken gem as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your Initiative count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a Bonus Action.

affects.special: unoccupied space as close to the broken gem as possible

Necrotic Bomb (Greater).name: Necrotic Bomb (Greater)
Necrotic Bomb (Greater).description:
Combining the worst parts of a rotting corpse with reagents most people consider unholy, Necrotic Bombs create a miasma of life-sucking substance when exposed to the air.

When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a Necrotic Bomb. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target makes a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus).

On a failure, the target takes [[/damage activity=x0UMzFtE0uY4seaM]] damage. Even on a successful save, the target takes [[/damage activity=Juti23Z1uaSwM6uL]] damage. In addition, each creature within 5 feet of the target takes damage as if it had successfully saved against the bomb. Constructs take no damage from a Necrotic Bomb.

Bolts.name: Bolts
Bolts.description:
Storage: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCaseCrossbo]{Case}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAmmunitionV]{Ammunition} is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Dust of Disappearance.name: Dust of Disappearance
Dust of Disappearance.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

This powder resembles fine sand. There is enough of it for one use. When you take a Utilize action to throw the dust into the air, you and each creature and object within a 10-foot Emanation originating from you have the Invisible condition for 2d4 minutes. The duration is the same for all subjects, and the dust is consumed when its magic takes effect. Immediately after an affected creature makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell, the Invisible condition ends for that creature.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description:
Source: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgDustOfDisappe]{Dust of Disappearance}

You have the &Reference[Invisible] condition for 2d4 minutes or until you make an attack roll, deal damage, or cast a spell.

Eyes of the Eagle.name: Eyes of the Eagle
Eyes of the Eagle.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

These crystal lenses fit over the eyes. While wearing them, you have Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

Javelin of Lightning.name: Javelin of Lightning
Javelin of Lightning.description:
Each time you make an attack roll with this magic weapon and hit, you can have it deal Lightning damage instead of Piercing damage.

Lightning Bolt. When you throw this weapon at a target no farther than 120 feet from you, you can forgo making a ranged attack roll and instead turn the weapon into a bolt of lightning. This bolt forms a 5-foot-wide Line between you and the target. The target and each other creature in the Line (excluding you) makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 Lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Immediately after dealing this damage, the weapon reappears in your hand. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Foundry Note

The Attack activity allows you to choose between Lightning and Piercing when rolling damage and will remember your last choice.

Poisoner's Kit.name: Poisoner's Kit
Poisoner's Kit.description:
Ability: Intelligence

Utilize: Detect a poisoned object (DC 10)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPoisonBasic]{Basic Poison}

Potion of Clairvoyance.name: Potion of Clairvoyance
Potion of Clairvoyance.description:
An eyeball bobs in this yellowish liquid but vanishes when the potion is opened.

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.cg50KpBkBdPK6vPL]{Clairvoyance} spell.

Potion of Healing (Greater).name: Potion of Healing (Greater)
Potion of Healing (Greater).description:
Potion, Uncommon

You regain 4d4 + 4 Hit Points when you drink this potion.

Whatever its potency, the potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

Potion of Heroism.name: Potion of Heroism
Potion of Heroism.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, you gain 10 Temporary Hit Points that last for 1 hour. For the same duration, you are under the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless} spell (no Concentration required).

This potion's blue liquid bubbles and steams as if boiling.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the effect ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Potion of Speed.name: Potion of Speed
Potion of Speed.description:
Potion, Very Rare

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHaste00000]{Haste} spell for 1 minute (no Concentration required) without suffering the wave of lethargy that typically occurs when the effect ends.

This potion's yellow fluid is streaked with black and swirls on its own.

mOzQSdWMLs0CvTKp.name: Rations
mOzQSdWMLs0CvTKp.description: Rations consist of travel-ready food, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts. See &Reference[Malnutrition] in the rules glossary for the risks of not eating.

Wand of the War Mage +2.name: Wand of the War Mage +2
Wand of the War Mage +2.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcWand000000]{Wand}, Uncommon (+1), Rare (+2), or Very Rare (+3) (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

While holding this wand, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls determined by the wand's rarity. In addition, you ignore &Reference[HalfCover] when making a spell attack roll.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Wand of the War Mage, +1, +2, or +3.name: Wand of the War Mage, +1, +2, or +3

Spell Scroll: Legend Lore.name: Spell Scroll: Legend Lore
Spell Scroll: Legend Lore.description:
5th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

Name or describe a famous person, place, or object. The spell brings to your mind a brief summary of the significant lore about that famous thing, as described by the DM.

The lore might consist of important details, amusing revelations, or even secret lore that has never been widely known. The more information you already know about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is. That information is accurate but might be couched in figurative language or poetry, as determined by the DM.

If the famous thing you chose isn't actually famous, you hear sad musical notes played on a trombone, and the spell fails.

Boots of Elvenkind.name: Boots of Elvenkind
Boots of Elvenkind.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Cloak of Elvenkind.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
Cloak of Elvenkind.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While you wear this cloak, Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive you have Disadvantage, and you have Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Glamoured Studded Leather.name: Glamoured Studded Leather
Glamoured Studded Leather.description:
Armor (Studded Leather Armor), Rare

While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class. You can also take a Bonus Action to cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like—including color, style, and accessories—but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this property again or doff the armor.

Mace of Disruption.name: Mace of Disruption
Mace of Disruption.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepMace000000]{Mace}), Rare (Requires Attunement)

When you hit a Fiend or an Undead with this magic weapon, that creature takes an extra 2d6 Radiant damage. If the target has 25 Hit Points or fewer after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be destroyed. On a successful save, the creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of your next turn.

Light. While you hold this weapon, it sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: On a successful save, the creature has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of your next turn.

Potion of Psychic Resistance.name: Potion of Psychic Resistance
Potion of Psychic Resistance.description:
Potion, Uncommon

When you drink this potion, you have Resistance to psychic damage for 1 hour.

Ring of Spell Storing.name: Ring of Spell Storing
Ring of Spell Storing.description:
Ring, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This ring stores spells cast into it, holding them until the attuned wearer uses them. The ring can store up to 5 levels worth of spells at a time. When found, it contains [[/r 1d6 − 1]] levels of stored spells chosen by the GM.

Any creature can cast a spell of level 1 through 5 into the ring by touching the ring as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect other than to be stored in the ring. If the ring can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While wearing this ring, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the ring is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

Foundry Note

To store a spell in this ring, drag the spell onto the Activities tab to create a "Cast a Spell" activity. Then change to the "Spell" tab, set the "Casting Level", check the "Override Values" box and enter the relevant Attack Bonus and Save DC from the original caster's values. You will then be able to cast that spell from this ring without expending your own slots. You will then need to delete the activity since each spell is a one-time use.

Spell Scroll: Ectoplasmic Expulsion.name: Spell Scroll: Ectoplasmic Expulsion
Spell Scroll: Ectoplasmic Expulsion.description:
5th Level &Reference[Spell Scroll]

You call upon multiple tendrils of ephemeral ectoplasm to pass through one creature you can see within range and carry away all harmful psychic afflictions. You end each spell or effect giving the target the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] or &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition. In addition, if the target is possessed, the possession ends. Each expelled effect manifests momentarily as a colored aura or other sensory cue that imparts to you its school of magic (if any) and then vanishes in the general direction of its caster or source. For the duration, the target has Advantage on saving throws against all the expelled spells and effects (whether from the same source or a different one).

Expelled Ectoplasm.name: Expelled Ectoplasm
Expelled Ectoplasm.description: You end each spell or effect giving the target the Charmed or Frightened condition. In addition, if the target is possessed, the possession ends. For the duration, the target has Advantage on saving throws against all the expelled spells and effects (whether from the same source or a different one).

results.2-2: @UUID[Actor.bif3iQcDPi27rx6x]{Salaisa Malthulas} from area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.G6wHEAz23uGrMSdy]{I14} and [[/r 1d4]] wardens from area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.iCO37ywz53IDWfVH]{I12}
results.6-7: Urdefhan warband: two @UUID[Actor.tZCFmJonHkhGg1Vs]{death scouts} and two @UUID[Actor.Sbxt8YT0AOFfVCPX]{lashers} from area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.rnPlOrzXgNElSkPN]{I34}
results.10-10: One @UUID[Actor.OTT7CCkonkfwhJ8Y]{blood mage} and three @UUID[Actor.FJr7Rc9MQEwxjAcz]{cult fanatics} from area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.6P5Lw4eeNrBQKv9O]{I35}
results.11-11: The @UUID[Actor.FHfrIJCdKTzy2rrR]{cauthooj} from area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.zRyrXydUmCGSSpzo]{I41}, which returns to its nest after 2 rounds

Guarded Intersection.name: Guarded Intersection
Guarded Intersection.text:
The passage upward to the Farm level is reasonably secure, but the drow keep a guard here regardless.

Creature

@UUID[Actor.NNpEVaXJBRAQYV5b]{Rikizlia}

A surly Drow Hunter named Rikizlia sits here on a stool, carving a bit of fungus wood with a small knife. If the characters stroll down without escort, she speeds toward area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.0VqYZ7IHaN7iM1Up]{I2} for help. If other drow accompany the characters, she watches them with open curiosity but doesn’t stop whittling.

Treasure: In addition to her weapons, armor, and [[/r 1d4]] doses of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgLolthsSting00]{Spider’s Sting} poison, Rikizlia carries Woodcarver’s Tools, [[/award 15sp]], and the key to a locker in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.yPrIOIwi1MtHQGco]{I9}.

Caravan Staging.name: Caravan Staging
Caravan Staging.text:
Several bags, barrels, and crates line the walls between this cavern’s three exits.

Caravans going between Yldaris and Lozardyn load and unload in this cave. The caravans are on an erratic schedule, but usually at least a few drow linger here. The passage east leads to a vast network of Darklands caverns beyond the scope of this adventure.

Creature

@UUID[Actor.QRjjE4TJNfaDhhQC]{Giant Lizards (2)}, @UUID[Actor.OqoWbYOyHDGHEeHV]{Drow Hunters (2)}, @UUID[Actor.DawBQWRyrM4cKfGI]{Drow Wardens (2)}, @UUID[Actor.VBXjZ1jYxdKf64B7]{Drow Scouts (2)}

When the characters first arrive, a handful of drow are unloading cargo from two harnessed Giant Lizards. The drow include two Drow Hunters, two Drow Wardens, and two drow Scouts. If the characters are under guard, or have otherwise gained the trust of Yldaris, the drow don’t confront or question them; otherwise, they mobilize a quick defense. When combat begins, the two wardens each unhitch a giant lizard (which doesn’t require an action) to fight alongside the drow. Meanwhile, one of the drow elves races to area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.i2uY8kRc2Y2TgMRy]{I3} to rally the creatures there to join the attack. Outnumbered or injured drow flee into the east passage and stay away for a few days.

The lizards are fully trained to work and fight, but they’re hostile to anyone they saw hurting their drow handlers. A character can buy a combat-trained giant lizard for [[/award 500gp]] while accompanied by a drow escort or allied with Yldaris.

Treasure: Each drow scout carries [[/award 1d6gp 3d10sp]] in addition to their weapons and armor. Each warden carries [[/award 3d6gp]] in addition to their equipment. Each hunter carries the key to a locker in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.yPrIOIwi1MtHQGco]{I9} among their gear.

Treasure

@Item[TaJnEqurF4EwfZBU]{Trade Goods}

The caravan’s trade goods include spices, dried fungus, and cloth that are all uncommon on the surface. The 160 pounds of goods are worth [[/award 640gp]] in total.

Stable.name: Stable
Stable.text:
This cavern contains pens for half a dozen giant lizards. A jumbled pile of harnesses sits near the corrals.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.DawBQWRyrM4cKfGI]{Drow Wardens (3)} @UUID[Actor.QRjjE4TJNfaDhhQC]{Giant Lizards (6)}

Three Drow Wardens are usually here, guarding and feeding Yldaris’s six Giant Lizards. The lizards can simply climb up out of the pens along the walls, but they don’t do so unless directed to fight by one of the wardens.

Treasure: In addition to their equipment, each warden carries [[/award 3d6gp]].

Secret Tunnel.name: Secret Tunnel
Secret Tunnel.text:
Exploration

This tunnel appears to come to a rocky end in the south, but this ersatz collapse hides a secret door the Yldaris hunters use to come and go from the caverns. Characters who investigate this dead-end can discover the secret door with a successful [[/check skill=investigation dc=18]] check. Any character who casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic} senses an aura of Abjuration on the wall.

The rubble swings aside when an invisible magical wall panel is touched by someone speaking any words in Elvish. The residents reinforced the secret door with magic, so it’s impossible to break through.

Yldaris Entry.name: Yldaris Entry
Yldaris Entry.text:
Iron sheets cover the outside of the western door, with a slot at drow eye level covered by a sliding plate on the inside. The door has no keyhole or handle and is reinforced by heavy bars. Anyone seeking entrance must either burst through the door (Hardness 15, Hit Points 60) or supply the secret knock known to all of the outpost’s drow (which occasionally changes) and wait for the guard to open it.

The door to the east, leading into Yldaris, uses the same construction, but it’s normally open and unbarred.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.fxNawCH81AZKWHuR]{Taklitur}

A Drow Warden named Taklitur stands guard inside the door, ready to admit anyone who gives the proper knock. If the warden hears the wrong knock, he first ignores it, thinking another drow is just misremembering. If the beats persist, or if he realizes someone is trying to break down the door, he opens the slot and fires his hand crossbow at anyone on the other side, before shutting it on his next turn and raising the alarm.

Treasure: Taklitur carries [[/award 10gp]].

Watch Chamber.name: Watch Chamber
Watch Chamber.text:
A table and chairs sit in the northeast corner of this large room. The walls feature words carved in a flowing script underscored with hash marks. Of the four doors leading out of this chamber, the door leading west looks sturdier than the others.

The words on the wall are drow aphorisms in Elven about staying alert and protecting one’s home. The hash marks record times the drow have repelled invaders and lived up to these sayings.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.Eu8oqypfXVR7kGIN]{Yrorix}, @UUID[Actor.OqoWbYOyHDGHEeHV]{Drow Hunters (2)}

When the characters first arrive, a Drow Shootist named Yrorix and a pair of Drow Hunters are playing cards with a drow version of a harrow fortune-telling deck. In the event of an assault, they knock on the three doors leading deeper into Yldaris to alert more defenders, but they make their stand here. If the characters are allies of Yldaris, the drow cheerfully invite the characters into their game. The stakes aren’t high, and the drow cheat relentlessly, but it might be an enjoyable way for the characters to pass the time. If the characters rescued Falxi Orshendiel from area @UUID[JournalEntry.KI33EAGPVHP4zyFZ.JournalEntryPage.fcEo2VAIF0ShGLVB]{F12}, he’s here gambling as well. Falxi is well regarded because he’s a distant cousin of Yldaris’s leader, but he’s fundamentally lazy. He greets the characters warmly and insists to his companions that they can be trusted.

A Peaceful Meeting: If any drow led the characters to meet with Quara, they stop here and ask the characters to leave their weapons for the duration of the meeting. Falxi (or, in his absence, Yrorix) promises to watch over their gear personally. As bringing armed strangers before their leader is expressly forbidden, the drow don’t negotiate on this point. If the characters balk, the drow lead them back out of Yldaris and invite them to return if they change their minds.

Treasure: Each hunter carries their normal equipment and the key to a locker in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.yPrIOIwi1MtHQGco]{I9}. Yrorix carries the key to a locker in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.p2mnVsnQtkAc4FD0]{I11} in addition to his equipment.

Treasure

@UUID[Item.FyUsI8mE3ZkbmDiT]{Drow Harrow Deck}

The deck of harrow cards is well worn but features unusual drow iconography. It’s worth [[/award 15gp]]. Stacks of wagers worth [[/award 240sp]] sit around the table.

Tanieth’s Abode.name: Tanieth’s Abode
Tanieth’s Abode.text:
This small room has a bed and table next to it. A ceramic mug and a modified hand crossbow sit next to the bed.

This is the sleeping quarters for a solitary shootist named Tanieth. Tanieth is a loner; when he isn’t resting here, tinkering with his repeating hand crossbow with parts from another, inoperable repeating hand crossbow, he’s ranging the Hunting Grounds alone. His good looks and remote demeanor make him something of a heartthrob among some Yldaris drow.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.u0Y8kY7CpnrXSHsI]{Tanieth}

Tanieth, a Drow Shootist, doesn’t like being disturbed. He tends to shoot first and ask questions later, even if it’s another drow who bothers him.

Treasure: His equipment includes Studded Leather Armor, an Elven Curve Blade, a Repeating Hand Crossbow, a full Shootist’s Bandolier, and five doses of Stupor poison.

Treasure

@UUID[Item.o8BzCYlXq8JSpZtL]{Tanieth's Mattress}

Tanieth has hidden several treasures under his mattress, including a small sack with [[/award 50gp]] and three opals worth [[/award 100gp]] each.

Hunters’ Mess.name: Hunters’ Mess
Hunters’ Mess.text:
Tables, chairs, dirty dishes, empty bottles, and utensils litter this chamber. It’s evident that creatures eat their meals here but very rarely clean up afterwards.

Yldaris’s hunters are skilled at their craft and keep their equipment in good working order but tend to be slobs in their day-to-day living. They usually avoid this place unless they’re eating.

Hunters’ Quarters.name: Hunters’ Quarters
Hunters’ Quarters.text:
The five bunk beds in this area are a mess of blankets and furs. A trio of locker boxes is stacked at the foot of each bunk.

While not in the total disarray of the adjacent mess hall, this room is remarkably untidy. The beds are unassigned; hunters simply grab a bunk when they can. Unlike the beds, each padlocked locker box belongs to a specific hunter. Each padlock requires five successful @Check[type:thievery|dc:30|traits:action:pick-a-lock]{Thievery} checks to unlock or a single @Check[type:athletics|dc:30|traits:action:force-open]{Athletics} check to Force Open. Most hunters carry their keys on their person.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.OqoWbYOyHDGHEeHV]{Drow Hunters (3)}

At least three Drow Hunters are usually resting here. They’re quick to rouse and confront danger, but it takes them time to get up and arm themselves.

Treasure: Each hunter wears a Chain Shirt and carries a Longsword, a Dagger, a Longbow, a Quiver of 20 Arrows, and three doses of Spider’s Sting poison.

Treasure

Unlike the beds, each of the fifteen padlocked locker boxes belongs to a specific hunter. Each padlock requires a successful [[/check ability=dexterity dc=25]] check using Thieves’ Tools to unlock or a [[/check ability=strength dc=25]] check to force it open. Most hunters carry their keys on their person.

Each lock box has a change of clothes, personal items, [[/award 2d10gp 4d10sp]]. One of the lock boxes (to which Rikizlia in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.f23Brb7jUwBNLvDR]{I1} has a key) also contains a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPotionofHea]{Potion of Healing}.

Target Practice.name: Target Practice
Target Practice.text:
A cluster of stools takes up one corner of this room, but most of it’s empty space with several reed-stuffed dummies dangling from the ceiling on the south wall. The dummies are full of holes, a few bolts still lodged in them.

The shootists engage in close-range target practice here.

Exploration

@UUID[Item.bIBiMJDO1Wotg1uj]{Secret Closet}

A secret door to the west conceals a storage closet; a character who searches the room and makes a successful [[/check skill=investigation dc=18]] check locates it. One of the hooks for hanging dummies from the ceiling, when pulled, causes the door to slide open. The secret room contains several discarded dummies, some atrocious fungus wine, and a Poisoner’s Kit with ingredients worth 700 GP (which can be used as raw materials for crafting poisons worth a total of [[/award 1400gp]]).

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.rArZ2y5xqSWeUU0G]{Drow Shootist}

There is typically at least one Drow Shootist practicing in this chamber, and at least two on subsequent visits after the characters’ first. They’re fiercely competitive and eager to challenge anyone who comes by, even outsiders under escort.

Wager: Each shootist offers to match wagers (up to [[/award 75gp]]) in a best-out-of-three shooting contest. If a shootist wins, they are eager to agree to a rematch up to once per day and raising their maximum wager by [[/award 50gp]]. If a shootist loses, they aren’t interested in a rematch for at least a week and have only [[/award 10gp]] to wager. Any defeated shootist is impressed enough to sell Repeating Hand Crossbows and Ammunition to the party at a 25 percent discount.

Treasure: In addition to their normal equipment, the shootist carries [[/award 80gp]] won from challenging others to shooting contests.

Shootists’ Quarters.name: Shootists’ Quarters
Shootists’ Quarters.text:
Four bunk beds are crammed into this room. In front of each of the bunk beds are a trio of sturdy, padlocked boxes.

The shootists tend to be much more orderly than the drow hunters, but this is still a communal space. Shootists come and go when they are not doing various other tasks in and outside of Yldaris and sleep where they’d like. The 12 lock boxes are similar to those in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.yPrIOIwi1MtHQGco]{I9}.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.rArZ2y5xqSWeUU0G]{Drow Shootists (2)}

There are typically a pair of Drow Shootists resting here at any given time. They’re quick to respond to any alarm or sounds of trouble, trying to outdo each other while putting up a vigorous defense.

Treasure: Each shootist wears Studded Leather Armor and carries a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.BoQ7pqlX54EHyRcS]{Repeating Hand Crossbow}, an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.SjiefF7DbgRPkbyD]{Elven Curve Blade}, a full @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.eUEXDCBuLBL0Rpw3]{Shootist’s Bandolier}, and five doses of @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.6F1A20MB89RVLyp0]{Stupor poison}.

Warden Barracks.name: Warden Barracks
Warden Barracks.text:
This room contains a pair of bunks and a low table.

Like the hunters and the shootists, drow wardens dwell in these barracks. The more regimented wardens insist on assigned bunks, but they don’t have lockboxes and thus keep their valuables with them and their personal items tucked inside their blankets.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.DawBQWRyrM4cKfGI]{Drow Wardens (5)}

There is typically at least one Drow Warden resting in each room. When any are in danger, they call out for the others, who quickly come out of their rooms. On their own, the wardens aren’t a significant challenge for level 9 characters, but if Salaisa Malthulas is present in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.G6wHEAz23uGrMSdy]{I14}, she joins the fight and orders in reinforcements from area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.sOpC75joa7ldQh6s]{I15}.

Treasure: Each drow warden carries [[/award 3d6gp]]. The rooms of unready wardens have their sets of Chain Mail and two doses of Spider’s Sting poison laid out alongside the rest of their equipment.

Overflow Lodging.name: Overflow Lodging
Overflow Lodging.text:
This room contains a pair of bunks, each with a carefully folded bedroll atop the mattress. At the foot of each sits a pair of strongboxes with padlocks and keys.

As with any border outpost, Yldaris’s population waxes and wanes with caravans coming and going at any given time. These rooms are set aside for visitors, and Quara offers them to the heroes. The empty locker boxes and padlocks are like those in area @UUID[.yPrIOIwi1MtHQGco]{I9}.

Master Warden’s Quarters.name: Master Warden’s Quarters
Master Warden’s Quarters.text:
The Master Warden Salaisa Malthulas keeps the door to her bedroom locked and the key on her person. The door requires a successful [[/check dex thief dc=25]] to unlock or a [[/check ability=strength dc=27]] check to force open.

This room is tidy and clean. It contains a bed, a small desk, and a large trunk.

Salaisa Malthulas, the competent and disciplined leader of Yldaris’s wardens, lives here. Quara Orshendiel trusts Salaisa, and the other drow all look to Salaisa for leadership when Quara isn’t around. If something happens to Quara, Salaisa becomes Yldaris’s next leader.

The desk contains extensive notes about the wardens of Yldaris: their names, schedules, personal quirks, and other evidence that Salaisa has been watching them all very closely for a long time. The trunk contains only her personal items.

Salaisa is continuously on the move, and she’s rarely in her room except to catch a bit of rest. The characters might encounter Salaisa anywhere in or near Yldaris. She’s not nearly as friendly with the characters as Quara is, and she’s concerned that having unknown surface- dwellers in Yldaris puts the whole community at risk.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.bif3iQcDPi27rx6x]{Salaisa Malthulas}

In a fight, Salaisa quickly seeks aid from any nearby drow. She’s reluctant to let opponents flee because she doesn’t want to have to fight them again later. She’s utterly loyal to Yldaris, and she fights to the death to protect it.

Treasure: Salaisa wields an @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.K62114ixt3qullK8]{Edge of Dissolution} Longsword, a gift from Quara’s grandmother. If the characters prove Salaisa was wrong to distrust them, perhaps by defeating Khurfel or reclaiming the Ochre Fulcrum Lens, Salaisa might lend them her magic sword for an important mission, such as entering the Gate of Nhimbaloth. In addition to her other gear, Salaisa wears a belt pouch containing [[/award 40gp]].

Treasure

@Item[jhpu9VZ9JreQaZOO]{Ruby Idol}

Salaisa’s desk contains suspicious items confiscated from visitors, including a ruby idol of the evil god Mazmezz worth [[/award 250gp]].

Common Area.name: Common Area
Common Area.text:
This large room contains several tables with benches and a few padded chairs. Heads of strange creatures hang stuffed and mounted on the walls.

The heads are trophies of creatures slain in the Hunting Grounds. They include an albino basilisk, a chuul with exceptionally long face tentacles, a phase spider, and an undersized seugathi.

The secret door on the south wall is one-way; it doesn’t open from this side. A character who searches the room can deduce its presence with a successful [[/check skill=investigation dc=20]] check.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.DawBQWRyrM4cKfGI]{Drow Wardens}

There are [[/gmroll 2d4]] Drow Wardens here at any time, eating meals or swapping stories of strange things they’ve seen out on patrol.

Treasure: Each warden carries [[/award 3d6gp]] in addition to their gear.

Kitchen.name: Kitchen
Kitchen.text:
Several fire pits and small ovens with flues bored into the rock walls stand about this chamber. Dishes and utensils are stacked on a central table. A basin of water stands in one corner, a soapy film across the top. Stacks of barrels and crates totter precariously against the south wall.

Yldaris has no dedicated cooking staff. Drow prepare their own food or talk others into cooking for them (a common penalty for losing at gambling or an athletic contest).

Encounter

@Actor[DawBQWRyrM4cKfGI]{Drow Wardens (1d4)}

There are typically [[/r 1d4]] wardens preparing meals here.

Great Chamber.name: Great Chamber
Great Chamber.text:
This massive chamber has a high, vaulted ceiling. At its center stands a small forge, anvil, and worktable with various tools. A few benches line the walls.

This massive chamber serves double duty as the outpost workroom and a meeting hall. The drow sometimes move tables here from other rooms to hold banquets or meetings. Quara Orshendiel meets with the characters here.

Treasure

@UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-items-5e.Item.cLQySkwkOGGCKTNd]{Repeating Hand Crossbow Magazine}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbtulCarpenters]{Carpenter's Tools}

A Repeating Crossbow Magazine and a set of Carpenter’s Tools are the only items of value here.

Drow Aid

Gaining the drow’s trust (see @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.F3CmB9Q0LVQ8NOpD]{Befriending the Drow}) is a tremendous boon to the heroes’ mission in the Hunting Grounds and beyond. Not only do they gain a safe place to rest, but they can also use the outpost’s forge and workspace (area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.hcb926Op2PfYoVwj]{I17}) to repair or even craft items, as well as practice a profession using Blacksmith’s Tools, Carpenter’s Tools, or a Poisoner’s Kit. Furthermore, traders can sell them any mundane items including poisons, gear, and weapons from the Adventure Toolbox. They also have access to the following magic items, and might be able to find others at your discretion. Items they don’t have on hand require a week or so to fetch from Lozardyn. The characters can also sell up to four Uncommon magic items to the drow each week.

Magic Items

Cost

Potion of Healing

[[/award 50gp]]

Potion of Greater Healing

[[/award 200gp]]

Potion of Superior Healing

[[/award 800gp]]

+1 Elven Curve Blade

[[/award 350gp]]

+1 Repeating Hand Crossbow

[[/award 450gp]]

Bag of Holding

[[/award 150gp]]

Boots of Elvenkind

[[/award 250gp]]

Slippers of Spider Climbing

[[/award 200gp]]

Wand of Web

[[/award 600gp]]

Seers’ Quarters.name: Seers’ Quarters
Seers’ Quarters.text:
This large room contains only two thin sleeping mats. The ceiling is painted with patterns resembling constellations.

Bhazrade and Klathor live here. The twins receive enigmatic divinations from the bare stone and share this wisdom to benefit Yldaris. When here, they’re usually meditating, facing each other on their mats.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.WBPgJZgbWq3kKfLM]{Bhazrade} @UUID[Actor.EdvXomv7pW8qduge]{Klathor}

While they are distant, silent, and rarely look at or acknowledge the presence of other people, the twins are loyal to Quara and the drow of Yldaris. In a fight, they use their occult powers to harry and scatter their foes to incapacitate them one at a time. Bhazrade and Klathor are both Drow Cavern Seers.

Treasure

@UUID[Item.XWDq6qXKttyeyUqr]{Spell Scroll of Legend Lore}

Bhazrade keeps a Spell Scroll of Legend Lore that he no longer needs under his meditation mat. The seers offer to sell it for [[/award 1000gp]] if the characters act on their vision and want more information than the brothers want to divine themselves (such as anything relating to the calignis or Belcorra’s past outside of the Abomination Vaults, which they or their stone spirits care little about).

Quara’s Chamber.name: Quara’s Chamber
Quara’s Chamber.text:
Both doors to this room are always locked, and Quara carries the keys. Picking each lock requires a successful [[/check dex thief dc=23]] check or a successful [[/check ability=strength dc=25]] check to break open. The inner door is also trapped, as described in “Hazard,” below.

An unmade bed piled with pelts sits next to a table stacked with books, small statues, and a plate with a half-eaten meal. A chest sits crookedly in the corner with some clothing spilling out of it.

This chamber has always housed Yldaris’s leader; it was most recently Larathols’s room, and now it’s Quara’s. This fact sits uneasily with her, as she still considers the room her father’s private space.

Exploration

The north wall contains a cunning secret door, which Quara can use to slip into the common area (area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.sOpC75joa7ldQh6s]{I15}) to find reinforcements or escape from trouble. Locating the secret door requires a successful [[/check skill=investigation dc=20]] check; opening it involves pushing the correct sequence of hidden wall panels to cause the wall to slide outward.

Hazard: The inner door bears an explosive runes version of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGlyphofWar]{Glyph of Warding} spell. Noticing the glyph requires a successful [[/skill 18 inv]] check. The glyph triggers when the door is opened without the key. If the glyph is triggered, each creature within 20 feet of the door must make a [[/save dexterity dc=18]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 6d8 average thunder]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Treasure

@UUID[Item.roxnXaffj3kTJlE5]{Quara's Chest}

Amid Quara’s personal items and changes of clothes within the open chest is a small iron box containing [[/award 15pp 100gp]], a gold and opal bracelet worth [[/award 75gp]], and two diamonds worth 300 GP each. The chest also contains a black Cloak of Elvenkind and a pair of Boots of Elvenkind. Quara loans these items to her people during sensitive missions in the Hunting Grounds. She might loan them to the characters if they’re on particularly good terms with her.

Meditation Cave.name: Meditation Cave
Meditation Cave.text:
This massive cavern is stunning. Among its gray stones cut veins and growths of crystals in lustrous shades of pearl white, dark purple, glimmering blue, and brilliant scarlet. At the center of the chamber waits a shallow pool, its bottom and sides made of the same glittering crystals.

This chamber is the closest thing that the outpost has to a temple, though few Yldaris drow are religious. Bhazrade and Klathor perform their rituals here.

Lodge Entry.name: Lodge Entry
Lodge Entry.text:
This large stone structure is flanked on one side by the massive Gauntlight footprint to the north, and on the other by the enormous iron ladder descending from the chasm that splits the Farm level. Belcorra built this lodge so those hunting in the wild caverns could relax in relative safety. In the earliest days, urdefhans, drow, and various mercenary hunters all used the lodge in a series of uneasy truces enforced by Belcorra and her Children. These truces fell apart when Belcorra died, and the lodge has changed hands several times since.

The calignis currently holed up inside the lodge are insular and reclusive. They venture out to gather food only rarely, as their leader Galudu takes care of most of their needs. The characters’ best way to speak to the calignis peacefully is to gain the trust of Custodian Dulac in the shrine above (area @UUID[JournalEntry.FwWmtOBFHhvM2gtf.JournalEntryPage.LyqYciAwy0l9vyed]{H8}). Otherwise, the calignis view anyone barging through this door as a threat, and the characters need to be especially diplomatic to placate them after.

Exploration

The door had a massive lock, but it was smashed long ago. Now, the calignis bar the door from the inside. It can’t be forced open, but it can be destroyed (AC 19, 50 Hit Points, damage threshold 10, Resistance to Slashing damage, Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). It’s also protected by the Hazard described below.

Hazard: Galudu placed a Glyph of Warding on this door. Noticing the glyph requires a successful [[/check skill=investigation dc=16]] check. The glyph triggers when a non-caligni touches the door. If triggered, the glyph casts a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (level 5 version, spell save DC 16).

Great Hall.name: Great Hall
Great Hall.text:
This large hall was once grand and impressive. Now the walls’ murals are chipped and stained, the floor is covered with mud, and the few pieces of furniture look like they’ve been hastily repaired many times. A fire pit sits at the center of the chamber.

Once a lively meeting place and banquet hall for hunters, the area now serves as an outpost where caligni refugees keep a careful watch for intruders. The two smaller doors of the area are unlocked, but the large double door to the west is barred from this side.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.OloMMRPtTQKF0x16]{Caligni Defenders (3)}

Three Caligni Defenders try to contain intruders and keep them from penetrating any deeper into the lodge. If possible, a defender moves to the smaller doors and knocks on them, alerting the other calignis to an attack. This brings the calignis in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.8iE1bRgAOvwLTzmw]{I23} and the bright walkers in area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.iduGvMRKIN2B46hv]{I24}, which makes this a very dangerous encounter for level 9 characters. The calignis fight to the death to defend the lodge. They partake of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHeroesFeas]{Heroes’ Feast} provided by Galudu every evening. As a result, they have Resistance to Poison damage and Immunity to the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.93uaingTESo8N1qL]{Frightened} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbAppendixCRule.JournalEntryPage.HWs8kEojffqwTSJz]{Poisoned} conditions. Both their current Hit Points and Hit Point maximum are increased by 11.

Treasure: Each defender carries [[/award 3d10gp]] in addition to their gear.

Caligni Bunks.name: Caligni Bunks
Caligni Bunks.text:
This room is filthy and smells stale. Rags and tattered rugs and blankets litter the floor.

This sleeping chamber is dimly lit, as the cracks around the door to area @UUID[.iduGvMRKIN2B46hv]{I24} glow.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.OloMMRPtTQKF0x16]{Caligni Defenders (2)}

The two Caligni Defenders resting here respond to any commotion in the great hall. If outclassed, a defender opens the door to area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.iduGvMRKIN2B46hv]{I24} to set the undead in that room free. These calignis also have the benefits of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHeroesFeas]{Heroes’ Feast}.

Treasure: Each defender carries [[/award 3d10gp]] GP in addition to their gear.

Strange Dead.name: Strange Dead
Strange Dead.text:
If the heroes examine the glow in the door’s cracks, it shifts as if the light source within is moving around.

A stack of dusty urns is heaped against the east wall of this small room. Each is covered with jagged runes.

The caligni keep out of this room due to its strange occupants, a pair of rare undead calignis called bright walkers. Only Galudu regularly comes here to speak with them; the other calignis only open the door if they need serious and immediate aid.

The urns are left over from when this place was a lodge for hunters. There are 11 urns in total, each 3 feet tall. They were used to magically preserve creature parts taken as trophies, but their magic expired long ago. Four urns contain shriveled claws or bones.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.ChRgdkplhO1D81Lg]{Bright Walkers (2)}

The two Bright Walkers pace restlessly in this room. They are aware that the calignis find their illumination painful, and the only reason they don’t go on a rampage around the Hunting Grounds is because Galudu does her best to keep them grounded and calm. When they see non-calignis, they assume the lodge is under attack and fight against intruders until destroyed, or until Galudu calls them off.

Old Rubbish.name: Old Rubbish
Old Rubbish.text:
Piles of broken furniture, rags, and other rubbish litter this dirty room.

Galudu sometimes meets with others here, rather than in her private chamber to the south. If the heroes are with Custodian Dulac, Dulac asks them to wait here while she privately informs Galudu about them.

Galudu’s Room.name: Galudu’s Room
Galudu’s Room.text:
A large bay window of transparent stone overlooks the wilderness outside the lodge, but it is so covered in grime that it’s difficult to see through with any clarity. A makeshift table has been erected near the center of the room, and a sleeping mat is rolled up to one side of it.

Creatures

@UUID[Actor.3Ll0LCZcmQmb7aV3]{Galudu}

Galudu, the Caligni Arcanist, spends most of her time here. She serves as leader and chief provider for the caligni refugees, feeding her people with conjured food and water when hunting parties return empty-handed—or don’t return at all.

If the characters have fought their way through the lodge, Galudu uses her spells to drive them off. With nowhere else to go, she fights to the death. Galudu casts Heroes’ Feast for herself and her people daily. As a result, she has Resistance to Poison damage and Immunity to the Frightened and Poisoned conditions. Both her current Hit Points and Hit Point maximum are increased by 11.

If Custodian Dulac has led the characters here, Galudu is wary but welcoming; if the characters have been able to aid Dulac and her band of foolish cultists, Galudu reasons, they might be able to help her as well. In this case, she listens to the characters’ background but quickly introduces the topic of her side quest, below.

Treasure: Galudu carries a Wand of Lightning Bolts.

Side Quest

Galudu explains that the calignis here are all refugees, fleeing from some calamity deeper in the Darklands that she doesn’t explain. Several calignis died before they made it to the safety of this lodge, so only the strongest now remain. She quickly glosses over the schism that led to Dulac breaking away to occupy the upper levels and establish the @UUID[JournalEntry.FwWmtOBFHhvM2gtf.JournalEntryPage.E91vlj3metWEl6BC]{Cult of Urthagul}; Galudu considers Dulac and her cult to be simpletons clinging at misplaced hope and doesn’t particularly care about their fate. She’s more interested in finding a safe exit for herself and her caligni defenders; the cultists are welcome to come along if they don’t slow Galudu down.

Galudu explains that there are two ways to leave, but both are blocked by powerful monsters: a daemon to the south (area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.sJbJvBLnTcfcPRLs]{I31}) and a dragon to the east (area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.cwYDvlHWV3sCAa1r]{I51}). Furthermore, hunting bands of urdefhans have whittled down the calignis’ numbers. If the characters agree to eliminate either the daemon or the dragon (or, better yet, have already done so) and escort the calignis to safety, Galudu gives them her magic wand as payment. Galudu doesn’t know that area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.ZoNiqNOdXR8zD5pG]{I42} also leads out of the Hunting Grounds, but she’s happy to take that passage if the heroes clear the way.

The characters are on their own to defeat the creature they choose and can come back to escort the calignis. As the defenders don’t let them in through area @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.VhKqePYVA3INg8gz]{I21}, they’ll have to return to the Farm level and descend through the shrine to return to Galudu. Once they report the way is clear, Galudu orders her defenders to make ready. She casts Heroes’ Feast and invites the characters to eat too, granting them powerful benefits for the trip.

Urdefhan Attack

If the characters accept the side quest, the journey with the calignis isn’t without incident. Urdefhan death scouts are watching for the calignis to come into the open. The denizens of areas @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.6P5Lw4eeNrBQKv9O]{I35} and @UUID[JournalEntry.1vlzl3NJsftNB9Dc.JournalEntryPage.w0VMeGekcaakkCSk]{I36} come together along with a summoned @UUID[Compendium.dnd-abomination-vaults.av-bestiary-5e.Actor.NW1Ax1QGE9W4DmiN]{Ceustodaemon} to assault the traveling group. This is a deadly encounter for level 9 characters, but they have the calignis on their side to help. Award the characters only half the usual XP for defeating the urdefhans alongside such potent allies.

XP Award: Award the characters [[/award 300xp]] for each caligni they successfully escort out of the Hunting Grounds (up to [[/award 1800xp]] for protecting all six in Galudu’s group, plus up to [[/award 3000xp]] for protecting all 10 in Dulac’s group).

Ladder Base.name: Ladder Base
Ladder Base.text:
A large, iron ladder stretches upward into the darkness. Its chains and rods are cracked and flaked with rust.

This ladder leads over 100 feet up to area @UUID[JournalEntry.FwWmtOBFHhvM2gtf.JournalEntryPage.0DvO7vVIbYZAhm3R]{H34}.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.NW1Ax1QGE9W4DmiN]{Ceustodaemons (2)}

Two Ceustodaemons prowl amid the rubble and fungus at the ladder’s base. They’re supposed to report to the urdefhans if anyone unusual uses the ladder, but they’re so eager for violence that they fight anyone they see. If the characters are descending the ladder, the daemons attack as soon as the first character steps onto the ground, which might put climbing characters at a disadvantage until they, too, make their way off the ladder. The daemons fight to the death.

Central Pit.name: Central Pit
Central Pit.text:
A ribbon of twisting light extends from a circular hole in the ceiling to a matching hole in the floor. The stone near the light looks pockmarked and infected. The rounded walls are decorated with snarling stone heads of fearsome monsters.

Gauntlight’s interior can’t be reached from this level; the only access is from 100 feet above (area @UUID[JournalEntry.FwWmtOBFHhvM2gtf.JournalEntryPage.rVwX8eSwEBHWEjcg]{H37}) or 100 feet below (area @UUID[JournalEntry.yn21bNM6kpV4xRol.JournalEntryPage.a9b40LjI7QwLgirk]{J20}). A creature that isn’t a Construct that ends its turn within the 5-foot- diameter ribbon of light makes a [[/save constitution dc=17]] saving throw, taking [[/damage 10d6 necrotic average]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

The numerous stone heads are simply decor that Belcorra liked; they constitute a checklist of sorts for aberrations. They include chuuls, fleshwarps, gugs, and many other monsters the characters have likely already encountered on their explorations in the Abomination Vaults, although the GM might use some unfamiliar heads to give hints about creatures they haven’t yet met. The heads aren’t made of the same invulnerable stone as Gauntlight and thus can be removed or destroyed normally.

Boathouse.name: Boathouse
Boathouse.text:
This squat stone building, only eight feet high, hugs the shore. Two wooden docks jut from the building into the dark waters of the massive underground lake. The doors are caked with mold and lichen, as if they haven’t been opened in years.

The Children of Belcorra once tended to this lake as they did the one above, but the urdefhans routed them centuries ago. During this rout, the urdefhans drove Beluthus, a powerful occultist among the Children of Belcorra, back to this boathouse and locked him in. Beluthus has remained inside ever since, succumbing to torpor like many of the other undead gnomes. In addition to being caked with mold, the doors have makeshift planks nailed across them on the outside. The planks are easy to pry off, but doing so is noisy and alerts Beluthus. Inside, an old but serviceable rowboat hangs from the ceiling on short chains.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.3ry9WSvMMXHUe3kE]{Beluthus}, @UUID[Actor.vHei0y2PKlXfxQ8Z]{Fobgus}

Beluthus, an Elder Child of Belcorra, wakes from his reverie when anyone starts prying open the doors or intrudes into the boathouse. His servant Fobgus, a Child of Belcorra, takes another round to rouse. Beluthus lashes out with fury immediately, eager to break free after his long torpor and then rejoin the Children of Belcorra in the level above.

Treasure

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgSwanBoatQuaal]{Feather Token (Swan Boat)}

The rowboat contains a small sea chest with a Swan Boat Feather Token.

Lizard Run.name: Lizard Run
Lizard Run.text:
The ceiling of this cavern sports many crystal growths and stalactites. A pattering drizzle drips from these formations, and paths wind through thick mounds of fungus growing on the ground.

The Yldaris drow have cultivated this area with thick, fast-growing fungus developed by drow mycologists in distant communities. These mushrooms hide drow movements and provide the community with a ready source of food.

Movement in this area is challenging, as the thick mushrooms conceal stalagmites and crystalline growths on the ground. For Yldaris drow and their riding lizards, who know the terrain, the area is simply Difficult Terrain; all other creatures must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot they travel.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.QRjjE4TJNfaDhhQC]{Giant Lizards (6)}

The drow let their riding lizards run free in this area while they grow to a size useful for hauling cargo. The predators of the cavern sometimes catch and kill an errant lizard, but the drow don’t mind the loss, as they can study the site of the kill and learn more information about the creatures hunting near their home.

There are currently six Giant Lizards here, all just reaching maturity. As two of their siblings were recently killed by urdefhan hunters, the lizards are all aggressive to non-drow Humanoids. A lizard reduced to fewer than 5 Hit Points flees the area.

Treasure

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgGreaterPotion]{Potion of Healing (Greater)}

While the giant lizards have no treasure, [[/award 87gp 120sp]] are scattered near the remains of a spider’s web. A dead drow in the web carries a Potion of Greater Healing.

The Barrens.name: The Barrens
The Barrens.text:
The fungus growth thins in this cavern, giving way to barren rock and rubble. Amid the dull gray stone, strange clouds of thick grayish-black fog hug the ground.

The Yldaris drow skirt the north stretch of this cavern then they come this way, knowing of the dangers that lurk deeper in. The drow call this place the Barrens; if the characters have earned their aid, they warn the characters of its risks: the fog is deadly, and the cavern harbors a dangerous monster.

The fog is Lightly Obscured, and visibility ends at 30 feet. A narrow passage leads south to distant Darklands caverns that are no less treacherous; those areas are outside the scope of this adventure.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.oKogG9AwUZ9iBsm3]{Derghodaemon}

A Derghodaemon lurks in the fog at the south end of the cavern. It keeps an eye on the deeper Darklands passages, both to protect the urdefhan hunting grounds from anything that might come from that way, as well as to ensure that the urdefhans always have access to other Darklands hunting grounds. It scuttles forth whenever anyone triggers the hazard, or when it otherwise hears intruders come close. Encountering the derghodaemon here raises its Challenge Rating to 13 ([[/award 10000xp]]), making it dangerous indeed to level 9 characters.

Hazard

The fog arose here because of the derghodaemon’s presence, and its effects are tied to the daemon’s cloud of misery. Whenever a creature that isn’t a Fiend or an urdefhan ventures more than halfway into the cavern, the mist solidifies into a life- draining mouth.

A character can sense the fog is oddly scratchy on the skin with a successful [[/check skill=wisdom (perception) dc=20]] check and can deduce that the strange behavior of the fog indicates a dangerous magical presence bound by a spell or similar magic. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic} spell or similar effect reveals an aura of Evocation spread across the cloud, growing stronger toward the middle.

When a creature that isn’t a Fiend or an urdefhan moves from the northern half of the cavern into the southern half, the cloud coalesces into dozens of tooth-filled mouths. The triggering creature and each creature within 20 feet of it makes a [[/save dexterity dc=20]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 10d6 piercing average]] damage or half as much damage on a successful one. If the save fails by 5 or more, the fog seizes the target and hurls it 60 feet in a random direction.

Once it coalesces, the cloud can’t do so again for 1 hour. A character who makes a successful [[/check skill=survival dc=18]] check can disperse the cloud, preventing it from coalescing for 1 minute. A successful @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic} (DC 15) permanently disables the cloud. If the derghodaemon is killed, the hazard disappears after a few minutes.

Into the Hunting Grounds

@Scene[Z5ExlCWEpqm0SMe1]{I - Hunting Grounds}

When we created the VTT-ready maps for this floor, we chose to divide it into three sections. Our goal was to provide the same resolution as the other maps without having any impact on performance. We hope this will ensure that all users would have the best possible experience.

If your players would like to continue to the north into the @UUID[.ZxWEWhGUw4kphhDf]{Southern Jumble}, you should activate the next scene and place down your players' tokens there.

You can find the scenes for the Hunting Grounds and Urdefhan Camp in the 09: On The Hunt folder of the scenes tab in your sidebar.

Southern Jumble.name: Southern Jumble
Southern Jumble.text:
Fungus grows wild and tall throughout this enormous cavern, sometimes reaching as high as thirty feet. The cavern ceiling, when visible through the fungal canopy, is higher still.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.czQFet5Qo63IXtHl]{Reaper Skull Puffballs (2)}

Some of the fungus in this wild section of the cave is dangerous. Two Reaper Skull Puffballs float toward the characters when they first enter this area, descending from the mushroom tops high above.

Heading South

@Scene[SkPDNmMoL4M4r1it]{I - Yldaris}

When we created the VTT-ready maps for this floor, we chose to divide it into three sections. Our goal was to provide the same resolution as the other maps without having any impact on performance. We hope this will ensure that all users would have the best possible experience.

If your players would like to continue to the south into @UUID[.sJbJvBLnTcfcPRLs]{The Barrens}, you should activate the next scene and place down your players' tokens there.

You can find the scenes for the Urdefhan Camp and the Yldaris outpost in the 09: On The Hunt folder of the scenes tab in your sidebar.

Ferocious Displays.name: Ferocious Displays
Ferocious Displays.text:
This wide cavern entrance is a disgusting sight. The walls are splashed with ocher and scarlet images in a riot of violent and obscene symbols. Stakes around the entrance hold up skulls and dismembered parts of strange creatures.

This is the main entrance of the cavern complex where the urdefhans live. Intelligent creatures in the Hunting Grounds avoid this place, knowing the urdefhans ruthlessly protect their territory.

Encounter

@UUID[Actor.Sbxt8YT0AOFfVCPX]{Urdefhan Lashers (2)}, @UUID[Actor.tZCFmJonHkhGg1Vs]{Urdefhan Death Scouts (2)}
